0.title: Man City, Real Madrid secure 3rd straight wins in Champions League, PSG held
0.article_body: Manchester City and Real Madrid defeated Copenhagen and Shakhtar Donetsk respectively in their respective group matches to secure their third straight wins in the Champions League on Wednesday night. PSG, however, were held to a 1-1 draw by Benfica. Notably, Chelsea got their first win in the competition under new coach Graham Potter, defeating AC Milan 3-0.

1.title: Uruli Devachi garbage depot in Pune turned into 'Amrut Van' forest
1.article_body: Once a garbage depot spread over 20 acres, a spot in Pune's Uruli Devachi has been turned into an urban forest, which is expected to be a major tourist attraction in the future. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has named it 'Amrut Van'. It had planted over 20,000 saplings that have grown into 10-foot-tall trees over the past three years.

2.title: Prabhas' 'Adipurush' poster a copy of our work, says animation studio; shares pics
2.article_body: An animation studio has claimed that a poster of 'Adipurush' is a copy of its work. Vaanar Sena Studios shared its own Lord Shiva poster and compared it with 'Adipurush' poster featuring Prabhas and wrote that the producers must at least credit it. "Such a shame, T- Series should mention the original creator, who developed the artwork," the caption read.

3.title: Electronics Mart India IPO subscribed 1.69 times, issue ends tomorrow
3.article_body: Electronics Mart India's IPO was subscribed 1.69 times on October 4, the first day of the subscription. The offer garnered bids for 10.58 crore equity shares against an offer size of 6.25 crore. Friday is the last day of subscription and the company, which is the fourth-largest consumer durables and electronics retailer in India, expects to raise ₹500 crore.

4.title: Sensex gains 473 points, Nifty above 17,400 in opening trade
4.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Thursday with the Sensex rising 473.55 points to 58,539.02 and Nifty up 140 points to 17,414.30. Infosys, Hindalco Industries, Tata Motors, Coal India and SBI Life Insurance were among the major gainers on the Nifty. Stocks of HDFC Limited and Hindustan Unilever Limited slipped. About 1,732 shares advanced and 415 shares declined.

5.title: 8-month-old Indian-origin baby, parents, uncle who were kidnapped in US found dead
5.article_body: The missing Indian-origin family kidnapped from California, US, earlier in the week has been found dead. Police announced that all four family members – eight-month-old Aroohi Dheri and her parents, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur and 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, and the baby's 39-year-old uncle Amandeep Singh – were found dead. "Tonight our worst fears have been confirmed," police added.

6.title: Prabhas, Om Raut celebrate Dussehra at Red Fort, perform Ravan Dahan
6.article_body: Actor Prabhas was in Delhi to celebrate Dussehra. The actor performed Ravan Dahan on Wednesday at Red Fort's Ramlila in the presence of his 'Adipurush' director Om Raut and Delhi's Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. Prabhas will be seen playing Lord Ram in 'Adipurush', which will also star Kriti Sanon as Janaki and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh.

7.title: Which are the 4 Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about?
7.article_body: The four Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about include Promethazine Oral Solution, Kofexmalin Baby Cough Syrup, Makoff Baby Cough Syrup and Magrip N Cold Syrup. WHO said the manufacturer, Haryana's Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, has not provided guarantees on safety and quality of these products. The syrups have been linked to 66 deaths among children in Gambia.

8.title: Mumbai court discharges man after lab finds baking soda, not drugs
8.article_body: A Mumbai court discharged a man accused in a narcotics case after a forensic lab report showed that the substance seized from him was not any drug but baking soda. The man was accused of carrying 100 grams of mephedrone. The prosecutor opposed the discharge application saying the report was not conclusive but the court allowed it.

9.title: 9, including 5 school children, killed as tourist bus crashes into KSRTC bus in Kerala
9.article_body: At least nine persons, including five school children, were killed and around 40 others were injured after a tourist bus crashed into another bus of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) in Palakkad district on Wednesday night, police said. The deceased also include three passengers of the KSRTC bus and another person a bus employee, police added.

10.title: 4 sanitation workers die while cleaning sewer at Faridabad hospital
10.article_body: At least four sanitation workers, all aged between 25 and 30, died while cleaning a sewer pit at a private hospital in Faridabad on Wednesday, police said. Initially, two workers entered the sewer and fainted after inhaling poisonous gas, police added. "When they didn't return, two more workers went...to rescue them after which they too fell unconscious," police stated.

11.title: 'Ram Setu' features exciting & thrilling action: Akshay Kumar
11.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar shared that his upcoming film 'Ram Setu' features some "exciting and thrilling" action sequences, which gave him an adrenaline rush after a long time. He also informed that the film's trailer will release on October 11. Directed by Abhishek Sharma, 'Ram Setu' marks Akshay's fourth release this year after 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Samrat Prithviraj' and 'Raksha Bandhan'.

12.title: SA ODIs will help T20 WC standby players to get into groove: Dhawan
12.article_body: India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan has said the three-match ODI series against South Africa will help the standby players for the upcoming T20 World Cup to get into the groove. "Who knows they might get a chance...look at this series as preparation," stated Dhawan. Shreyas Iyer, Ravi Bishnoi and Deepak Chahar are the standbys who will feature in SA ODIs.

13.title: Hyderabad Police arrests man for cheating clients through dating app
13.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police has arrested a man from Delhi for allegedly cheating clients through a dating app named Gigolo Playboy Services. The accused set up call centres and hired some girls to talk to the clients through the app, luring them to transfer money, said police. The complainant, one of the clients, transferred over ₹1.5 crore.

14.title: 8 die, several feared missing after flash floods in WB during idol immersion; video surfaces
14.article_body: At least eight people died and several others are feared missing after flash floods hit Mal river in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri during Durga Puja idol immersion. The video of the incident has surfaced online. "We've rescued around 50 people," DM Moumita Godara said. Expressing his condolences PM Narendra Modi said, "Anguished by the mishap during Durga Puja festivities in Jalpaiguri."

15.title: Jaya shouts at fans taking pics with Abhishek during temple visit, video surfaces
15.article_body: A video shows actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry and shouting at fans taking selfies with Abhishek Bachchan during a temple visit in Bhopal. While Abhishek can be seen obliging some of the fans, Jaya can be seen shouting asking them to stay away. "Don't you have no shame?" she can be heard saying in the video.

16.title: 'Thank God' is first script I heard from start to finish: Sidharth
16.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said the script of 'Thank God' is the first script that he heard from the beginning to the end. The actor, who is looking forward to the film's release, said the Indra Kumar directorial is a "relatable story" and has a "wonderful message by the end". The comedy film also stars Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh.

17.title: Sonia Gandhi to join Congress’ 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Karnataka today
17.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will participate in the party’s 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Thursday in Karnataka. This will be her first participation in the yatra, which began while she was abroad for a medical check-up. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday. The yatra will pass through Karnataka for 21 days covering 511 km in the state.

18.title: Video shows the moment man kidnaps 4 Indian-origin people, including 8-month-old, in US
18.article_body: The authorities in US released a video showing the moment four members of an Indian-origin family, including an 8-month-old baby, were kidnapped in US' California. The video shows two family members, Jasdeep Singh and Amandeep Singh, being forced out of building with hands zip-tied together. The video later shows the gun-wielding kidnapper leading Jasleen Kaur and her baby into truck.

19.title: Putin orders his government to take control of Europe's largest nuclear plant
19.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday ordered his government to take control of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest. Russia captured it shortly after invading Ukraine, but Ukrainian staff have continued to operate it. Meanwhile, the chief of Ukraine's state energy agency announced he was taking over the plant.

20.title: North Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles in direction of Japan
20.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles into the sea in the direction of Japan on Thursday. This comes after the return of US aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan to the region and a UN Security Council meeting in response to North Korea's recent launches. North Korea said the aircraft carrier posed serious threat to the stability of the situation.

21.title: Nigerian regulator sues Meta, seeks $70 mn fine for 'showing unvetted ads'
21.article_body: The Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON) has filed a lawsuit against Meta and sought $70 million fine for "publishing unauthorised ads". "The continued publication and exposure of various advertisements directed at Nigerian market through Facebook and Instagram...by Meta...without ensuring the same is vetted and approved before exposure is illegal, unlawful," the court filings said.

22.title: Mumbai man misbehaves with daughter-in-law, seeks sexual favours; jailed
22.article_body: A Mumbai court has sentenced a 65-year-old man to three-year rigorous imprisonment for inappropriately touching his daughter-in-law and asking her for sexual favours. He'd asked his daughter-in-law to engage in a particular sexual behaviour with him, as per a pandit's advice, to solve problems happening in their home. The woman had gotten married to his son a few months earlier.

23.title: 24-yr-old delivery rider lies about being robbed in Delhi; arrested
23.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery rider was arrested for allegedly hatching a conspiracy about being robbed in Delhi's Neb Sarai, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he was held at gunpoint and was robbed of ₹31,000, a police official said. The accused hatched the plan after delivering a phone in Neb Sarai, DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary said.

24.title: Ex-driver kills 86-yr-old woman, robs her of ₹3 lakh in Delhi
24.article_body: An 86-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her ex-driver, who entered her house and escaped with ₹3,20,000, police said on Wednesday. The accused revealed during interrogation that he was aware of the money, said DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma, adding that he roamed near the house with a knife all day and later stabbed the victim.

25.title: 'Want a casteless society': Thousands of Dalits convert to Buddhism in Delhi
25.article_body: Several thousand Dalits from Delhi-NCR on Wednesday reportedly converted to Buddhism at an event attended by Delhi Cabinet Minister Rajendra Gautam. "[We want]...a casteless society...We don't want our children to be murdered for drinking water from...pots [or] keeping a moustache," one of the attendees told reporters. The event was held at Ambedkar Bhavan in Delhi's Jhandewalan area.

26.title: Thane woman forges marriage papers to get properties worth ₹19 cr, held
26.article_body: A Thane woman was arrested along with two others for allegedly forging her marriage certificate to get ownership of movable and immovable assets worth ₹19 crore belonging to her deceased husband. Anjali Agarwal reportedly forced her husband, Anil Papde, to sign the certificate by threatening to tell everyone about his HIV diagnosis. Agarwal and her accomplices were arrested on Monday.

27.title: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeat Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings to win LLC 2022
27.article_body: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeated Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings by 104 runs in the final to win Legends League Cricket 2022. Batting first, India Capitals posted a total of 211/7 despite being 21/4 at one stage. Ross Taylor top-scored for India Capitals with 82(41). Bhilwara Kings were bowled out for 107 in 18.2 overs.

28.title: 4 killed as suicide bomber targets Afghan Interior Ministry mosque
28.article_body: At least four people were killed after a suicide bomber struck a mosque inside the Taliban-controlled Afghan Interior Ministry in Kabul on Wednesday. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Wednesday's attack follows last week's suicide bombing in Kabul which claimed 35 lives, according to the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

29.title: Turkey to send troops to Qatar for football World Cup security
29.article_body: The Turkish Parliament on Wednesday approved sending its soldiers to Qatar for helping in security arrangements during the football World Cup next month. Former Turkish Defence Minister Fikri Isik said the deployment would include 250 troops and a naval vessel. Further, Turkey has already assured it will send around 3,000 riot police personnel to Qatar during the international competition.

30.title: Completely untrue: Brad Pitt's representative on claims that he choked one of his kids
30.article_body: A representative for Brad Pitt has denied Angelina Jolie's allegations that he choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016, stating they are "completely untrue". Jolie had also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

31.title: WI's Kyle Mayers smashes 105-metre six over cover, cricketers react as video  goes viral
31.article_body: West Indies' Kyle Mayers slammed a 105-metre six over cover during the first T20I against Australia. Reacting to a viral video of the shot, former India opener Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "You are not allowed to do this!" Meanwhile, Adam Gilchrist wrote, "I'm sure there has been a better shot in the history of the game...but I just can't remember it!"

32.title: Our rebellion was not betrayal, but a revolt: Shinde on Shiv Sena split
32.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that the rebellion by him and other Shiv Sena leaders which led to the split in the party wasn't an act of betrayal, but a revolt. He said voters elected Shiv Sena and the BJP in 2019 in Maharashtra, but Uddhav Thackeray betrayed people by joining hands with the Congress and the NCP.

33.title: Indian-origin Vivek Murthy to represent US on WHO Executive Board
33.article_body: Indian-origin Dr Vivek Murthy has been nominated by US President Joe Biden to serve as the country's representative on the World Health Organisation's (WHO) Executive Board. The White House said Dr Murthy will continue his duties as the US Surgeon General alongside his new position. In March 2021, Dr Murthy was confirmed the US' 21st Surgeon General.

34.title: India, EFTA bloc mull resumption of talks on free trade deal: Reports
34.article_body: According to sources, India and the European Free Trade Association (EFTA), which consists of Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland, are planning to resume the negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) after a gap of several years. According to officials, Switzerland has been in talks with India for the FTA. India's total trade with EFTA during 2021-22 was $27.23 billion.

35.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for September as 3 Indians included?
35.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of September. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan, Australia's Cameron Green and India's Axar Patel have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while India's Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana, and Bangladesh's Nigar Sultana have been nominated in the women's category.

36.title: Some became 'Kattappa', betrayed us when I was in hospital: Uddhav
36.article_body: During the Dussehra rally at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray called the rebel Shiv Sena leaders "Kattappa", a character from 'Baahubali' franchise. He said, "The only thing I feel bad and angry about is that when I was admitted to the hospital, the people whom I gave the responsibility (of the state) became 'Kattappa' and betrayed us."

37.title: Ukraine takes first step towards joining OECD economic group
37.article_body: Ukraine took its first step towards joining the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) after the OECD said it could be a prospective member. Secretary General Mathias Cormann said the OECD's 38 members have decided to recognise Ukraine as a prospective member following a request from Kyiv. OECD closed Russia's accession process after it invaded Ukraine in February.

38.title: Video shows new 70,000-square feet Hindu temple inaugurated in Dubai
38.article_body: Industrialist Anand Mahindra shared the video of the Hindu Temple of Dubai, which was officially inaugurated on Wednesday. "I believe this magnificent temple was formally inaugurated today. Auspicious timing. Will make sure to visit it on my next trip to Dubai," he wrote. The 70,000-square feet temple, located in Jebel Ali, has 16 deities.

39.title: EU agrees to impose price cap for Russian oil over Ukraine war
39.article_body: EU officials said that member nations have agreed to impose a price cap on Russian oil and other sanctions after Moscow annexed four Ukrainian regions. The deal includes curbs on exports of aircraft components to Russia and limits on steel imports. EU will also ban the transport of Russian oil by sea to other countries above the price cap.

40.title: Fan mocks Pakistan's Shadab Khan over tweet, asks him to focus on World Cup; he responds
40.article_body: A fan mocked Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan over his tweet thanking his teammate Iftikhar Ahmad for birthday wish. "Ye shaddy shoody k chakr choro and please focus on World Cup," the fan wrote. Shadab, who's currently in New Zealand, responded, "It's late night in NZ...Physio has asked us to rest...Should I hang upside down and start training if you want?"

41.title: Video of boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit goes viral, PM says 'Heartening to see'
41.article_body: A video of a boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit during a gully cricket match has gone viral on social media. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also shared the video, tweeting, "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "What lovely flow and spontaneity. Sanskrit is a great language."

42.title: I am under house arrest: Ex-J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti
42.article_body: Former CM of erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday claimed she was under house arrest and was stopped from travelling to Pattan. “Was finally allowed to leave my residence only because the HM (Amit Shah) has headed back to Delhi,” she later tweeted. Meanwhile, Srinagar Police said “no restriction of any kind” was placed on Mufti’s travel plan.

43.title: Lee releases video on how cricketers should avoid injuries, says 'Ice baths are rubbish'
43.article_body: Ex-Australia fast bowler Brett Lee released a video on how cricketers should avoid injuries. Lee said that fast bowlers should not lift heavy weights as lean muscle mass is key. He also criticised ice baths which are used for recovery in modern-day cricket. Calling ice baths "rubbish", he stated, "There is no scientific evidence to prove that they work."

44.title: Fire breaks out at cloth market in Delhi, 35 fire tenders on spot
44.article_body: A fire broke out at a cloth market in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar on Wednesday. No casualties have been reported so far, fire department officials said. As many as 35 fire tenders reached the spot after receiving a call about the fire in the evening. As per reports, the fire tenders had to be parked far away due to narrow lanes.

45.title: IIT-Delhi's curriculum set for complete revamping: Director
45.article_body: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi's new Director, Rangan Banerjee, said the institute's curriculum is set for a total revamping after over a decade. A panel has been formed to review the curriculum of all courses, Banerjee told PTI. "We are trying to provide in our curriculum, challenges and opportunities...hence a complete revamp was needed," he said.

46.title: India supported 85% of its rural households during the pandemic: WB
46.article_body: World Bank (WB) President David Malpass on Wednesday praised the Indian government’s support to the poor during the COVID-19 pandemic, specifically lauding India's targeted cash transfer programme. Malpass said, "Helped by digital cash transfers, India managed to provide food or cash support to a remarkable 85% of rural households." He urged other nations to adopt similar measures.

47.title: Apollo Hospitals acquires 60% stake in AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore
47.article_body: Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Ltd has acquired a 60% stake in Ayurveda hospital chain AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore, PTI reported. The investment will reportedly be used to upgrade existing centres and for digital health initiatives. Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Chairman Prathap C Reddy said the Apollo-AyurVAID partnership will be a beacon of hope for Indians and medical value travellers around the world.

48.title: Tamil Nadu govt invites Czech aircraft manufacturer to invest in state
48.article_body: Tamil Nadu government said that the state has invited Czech Republic-based light aircraft manufacturer Evektor Aircraft to invest in the state. Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, TM Anbarasan, was explained the investment opportunities available in their country by the senior government officials during his visit to the MSV International Engineering Fair in Czech Republic.

49.title: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa decide to call off divorce after 9 months: Report
49.article_body: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who announced their separation in January earlier this year, have decided to put their divorce on hold, as per several reports. According to reports, the families of both parties met at Rajinikanth's home and agreed that they should work on their marriage. Dhanush got married to Aishwaryaa, Rajinikanth's eldest daughter, in 2004.

50.title: Sonia Gandhi offers prayers at Karnataka temple on Dussehra
50.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi visited the Bheemanakolli temple in Begur village of Karnataka's Mysuru on Wednesday to offer prayers on the occasion of Dussehra. She was accompanied by village panchayat members and local MLA Anil Kumar C. The Congress leader is in Karnataka for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which will commence on Thursday after a two-day break for Dussehra.

51.title: SpaceX & NASA launch crew of 4, including a Russian cosmonaut, to ISS
51.article_body: SpaceX on Wednesday launched its Crew Dragon capsule from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in US' Florida to take two American and one Japanese astronaut and one Russian cosmonaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The capsule was launched using SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket at 9:30 pm (IST). The rocket's reusable lower-stage booster landed back safely on a drone recovery vessel.

52.title: Amit Shah visits Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in J&K's Srinagar
52.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah visited Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in Rainawari area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Wednesday, officials said. He was accompanied by Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha and some BJP leaders. Earlier on Wednesday, Shah addressed a public rally in Kashmir's Baramulla and later visited the family members of a slain policeman in Uri.

53.title: 1 worker killed, 7 injured as elevator crashes at textile factory in Surat
53.article_body: A 35-year-old worker was killed and seven others were injured after a goods elevator crashed from the third floor of a textile factory in Surat on Wednesday. According to police, the cable snapped and lift crashed down 30 feet. "Among the seven injured, condition of five is serious as they suffered multiple fractures," CMO of New Civil Hospital said.

54.title: UP CM Adityanath feeds leopard cub with milk bottle at Gorakhpur zoo
54.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday inspected Gorakhpur's Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park, where he also fed milk to a leopard cub. A video released by the state government showed Adityanath cradling the cub and feeding it with a milk bottle while wearing rubber gloves. MP Ravi Kishan, veterinarians and zoo officials were also present at the scene.

55.title: OPEC+ panel agrees to cut oil production by 2 million barrels/day
55.article_body: The panel of OPEC+ ministers on Wednesday agreed to cut oil production in member countries by two million barrels/day. The supply-cut could cause a rise in crude oil prices that have dropped to about $90/barrel from $120/barrel three months ago on fears of a global recession. United States of America had suggested OPEC to not proceed with the cuts.

56.title: WHO warns against taking 4 Indian cough, cold syrups after 66 kids die in Gambia
56.article_body: The WHO on Wednesday warned using four cough and cold syrups that are potentially linked to acute kidney injuries and 66 deaths among children in Gambia. The four contaminated syrups are produced by Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, in India, the WHO said. "WHO recommends all countries detect and remove these products from circulation," the organization added.

57.title: Elon Musk, Twitter yet to reach deal to end lawsuit: Report
57.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk and Twitter have not yet reached an agreement to end the lawsuit and execute the latter's $44-billion takeover by Musk, Reuters reported. This comes after Musk proposed to go ahead with the deal he proposed in April if Twitter dropped its lawsuit against him. Twitter and Musk's lawyers said they're attempting to try to overcome mutual distrust.

58.title: Anubhav Sinha was supposed to launch me in B'wood: Sidharth Malhotra
58.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who made his debut in Karan Johar's 'Student Of The Year', revealed that he was to be launched in Bollywood by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha. "The film wasn't 'Fashion', but he (Anubhav) was the director who was supposed to launch me and two other actors," he stated. Sidharth added that the film didn't take off for various reasons.

59.title: You're a bully & a joke: Gigi on Kanye West insulting Vogue editor
59.article_body: Model Gigi Hadid has reacted after Kanye West insulted Vogue editor Gabriella Karefa-Johnson after she criticised Kanye's 'White Lives Matter' t-shirts. In a now-deleted Instagram post, Kanye had posted Gabriella's picture and wrote, "This is not a fashion person." Reacting to Kanye's post, Gigi commented, "You wish you had a percentage of her intellect...You're a bully and a joke."

60.title: 3 persons of a family electrocuted to death in Odisha's Boudh
60.article_body: Three persons of a family died of electrocution at their residence in Odisha's Boudh, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday when one of the deceased, Sukanti Behera, was hanging a wet cloth on a wire which accidentally came in contact with another live wire. Her son and brother-in-law were also electrocuted while trying to save her, police said.

61.title: DMK not against spiritualism, but against mixing religion with politics: TN CM
61.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday said the DMK is not against spiritualism but is against using religion for political and selfish gains. "Those using religion for their political survival allege that...Dravidian model of governance is against religion and beliefs," he said. He also accused his detractors of launching a disinformation campaign against him and his party.

62.title: 5 people drown during Durga idol immersion in Rajasthan's Ajmer
62.article_body: Five people drowned in a ditch filled with rainwater during the immersion of Goddess Durga idol in Rajasthan's Ajmer on Wednesday, police said. "They thought it was a shallow ditch and went down," SHO Hemraj said. The deceased were identified as 35-year-old Pawan Raigar, 28-year-old Gajendra Raigar, 24-year-old Rahul Meghwal, 21-year-old Lucky Bairwa and 20-year-old Rahul Raigar.

63.title: IAF deploys 2 helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in Uttarakhand
63.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has deployed two helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in snow after an avalanche hit Draupadi ka Danda-2 mountain peak in Uttarakhand. The helicopters were deployed from Uttar Pradesh. A video shared by the IAF showed a helicopter hovering over the avalanche-hit peak. As per reports, 14 people from the mountaineering team were rescued on Wednesday.

64.title: Asteroid hit by NASA leaves 10,000 km trail of debris; pic surfaces
64.article_body: An asteroid that was deliberately hit by NASA on September 26 has left an expanding, comet-like trail of debris stretching 10,000 kilometres, a picture showed. The picture was taken two days after the impact by astronomers in Chile. On September 26, NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test aircraft hit the asteroid in NASA's first attempt to move an asteroid in space.

65.title: India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings increase by 4.6% in August
65.article_body: According to data from the RBI, India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings in August this year increased by nearly 4.6% to $2.98 billion. Over $2.47 billion of the total borrowings was through the automatic route of raising funds from foreign sources. While over $502.79 million was raised by way of issuing rupee denominated bonds (RDBs) or masala bonds.

66.title: Shah gets his bulletproof shield removed at Baramulla rally, video surfaces
66.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah had his bullet-proof glass shield removed from the podium before addressing a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Wednesday. He stated that he wanted to directly connect with the people and didn't want any sort of interruption. Shah embarked on a three-day visit to the union territory on October 3.

67.title: India will overtake US as Unilever's 'largest business': HUL CEO
67.article_body: During an interview, Hindustan Unilever's (HUL) CEO and MD Sanjiv Mehta said that India will overtake the US as Unilever's 'largest business'. "I clearly see a day when HUL will become the largest Unilever business," he said, adding that he could not give a timeframe. According to company data, HUL currently accounts for about 10.7% of Unilever group sales.

68.title: Gazprom resumes gas exports to Italy via Austria
68.article_body: Russian energy giant Gazprom said it has resumed gas exports to Italy via Austria on Wednesday after resolving an issue over guarantees. Gazprom said regulatory changes in Austria had made it possible to resume the exports. Italian energy group Eni confirmed that supplies had resumed, adding that it expected only part of the gas requested to arrive on Wednesday.

69.title: WTO forecasts further trade growth slowdown in 2023
69.article_body: The World Trade Organisation (WTO) has predicted a sharp slowdown of global goods trade growth next year as increasing energy prices, interest rates and food and fertiliser bills have curbed import demand. It said that 2023 could see a trade growth of just 1%. WTO provided a band of growth expansion of 2.0%-4.9% for 2022 and -2.8%-4.6% for 2023.

70.title: Man gets new look after robbing ₹12 crore from bank, caught in Pune 2 months later
70.article_body: Police have arrested the main accused involved in the ₹12 crore cash theft from ICICI Bank in Thane's Manpada area from Pune after more than two-and-a-half months, an official said. The accused, Altaf Shaikh, had been working with ICICI Bank as a custodian. After the incident, he escaped and would change his looks and use burqa to hide his identity.

71.title: SWIFT lays out blueprint for global central bank digital currency network
71.article_body: Financial messaging system SWIFT has laid out its blueprint for a global central bank digital currency network following an eight-month-long experiment on different technologies and currencies. The experiment included 14 central and commercial banks, connected to SWIFT's main hub, said SWIFT's head of innovation Nick Kerigan. The experiment will be followed by more advanced testing over next year.

72.title: JSW Energy to install 960 MW hydro pump storage project in Maharashtra
72.article_body: JSW Energy has signed an agreement with the Maharashtra government to establish a 960-megawatt hydro pump storage project in Raigarh district. JSW's statement said that hydro pump storage is a well-established technology that provides adequate peaking power reserves, reliable grid operation, energy balancing and storage capacity. JSW did not reveal any financial details of the project.

73.title: Govt plans to auction 22 mineral blocks in next 2 months
73.article_body: The government is planning to auction 22 mineral blocks in Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh and Goa in November and December. The mines include six iron-ore blocks, three each of limestone and gold, two bauxite blocks, and one each of copper, phosphorite and glauconite. The Ministry of Mines has expressed hopes of auctioning 500 mines by the end of 2024.

74.title: I've read reviews where people said to not work with Hrithik: Saif
74.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said working in 'Vikram Vedha' was exhausting as he wanted to perform well with Hrithik Roshan. "Hrithik is not entirely human or normal...there's something so incredibly gifted about his presence...ability to...pull the eye to everything he's doing," Saif added. Saif stated he's read reviews where people said to not work with Hrithik "because it'll destroy you".

75.title: Govt sets up two advisory committees to resolve challenges in steel industry
75.article_body: The Ministry of Steel said that it has established two advisory committees, one each for the ISPs and the secondary sector to iron out the challenges in the steel industry. The ministry said the committees aim to achieve the target of 300 million tonne of production capacity by 2030. Several meetings of the committee have been held since their formation.

76.title: Central bank monetary tightening will prevent entrenched inflation: IMF
76.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said that recent monetary tightening by many central banks globally will prevent entrenched inflation. "Front-loaded monetary policy tightening...can lower the risk that inflation will become de-anchored from its target," it said. Recently, RBI raised its repo rate by 50 bps to 5.90%. Earlier, US Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 75 basis points.

77.title: 'Ravan is different this year': Uddhav to Maha CM Shinde on Dussehra
77.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday called the rebel Eknath Shinde camp "traitors", adding that the "stain on them will remain forever". While addressing a gathering from Shivaji Park on Dussehra, Thackeray said that we burn Ravan every year, but this year "Ravan is different". Shinde faction's rally was held at the MMRDA ground in Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC).

78.title: 4 of family killed as LPG cylinder explodes at their home in UP
78.article_body: Four members of a family, including a 10-month-old, were killed and two were injured after an LPG cylinder exploded at their house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Wednesday. Police said the incident took place due to leakage in the cylinder pipe. The wall of their two-storey house collapsed due to the blast.

79.title: Thought this is how B'wood is after 'English...', later met a*sholes: Sumit
79.article_body: Actor Sumit Vyas, speaking about 'English Vinglish', said that it was his first time working in a fully commercial film setup. He added that film's director Gauri Shinde, producer R Balki and Sridevi were grounded. Sumit stated he felt everyone in the film industry was like this. "But of course later, I met a bunch of a*sholes," he jokingly added.

80.title: Amit Shah pauses speech after hearing 'Azaan' from nearby mosque in Baramulla, video viral
80.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah today briefly stopped his speech during a rally in Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir as 'Azaan' was going on in a nearby mosque. People in the gathering applauded Shah for his gesture. After a while, he said the call for the prayer has now stopped and asked the crowd if he could continue his speech.

81.title: Jasprit Bumrah shares Winston Churchill quote aimed at his critics
81.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to back injury, took to Instagram Stories to share a quote aimed at his critics. Bumrah used the quote originally said by ex-UK PM Winston Churchill. The quote read, "You'll never reach your destination if you stop and throw stones at every dog that barks."

82.title: Ajinkya Rahane, wife Radhika blessed with a baby boy
82.article_body: Cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika Rahane have been blessed with their second child, a baby boy. "Both Radhika and the baby are doing well and are completely healthy. We'd like to thank you for all your love and blessings," Ajinkya wrote on Instagram. Ajinkya and Radhika were blessed with their first child, daughter Aarya, in October 2019.

83.title: If Ravan's effigy is burnt, Ram's will go up in flames too: Dalit Sena in K'taka
83.article_body: Dalit Sena on Wednesday said if the effigy of Ravan is burnt, the effigy of Lord Ram will go up in flames too. Dalit Sena is opposing Hindu groups organising burning of a 50-foot-tall Ravan effigy in Appa Jatra ground in Karnataka's Kalaburagi on occasion of Vijayadashami (Dussehra). They've claimed the programme is being held without permission from authorities.

84.title: Speeding truck mows down 7 in J'khand; 2 women, 1 child among 5 killed
84.article_body: A speeding truck mowed down seven people in Jharkhand's Ramgarh, leading to the death of five people, including two women and one child who died on the spot. All seven people were waiting to hire a vehicle on Ramgarh-Patratu state highway. The truck driver fled the spot, leaving behind his vehicle. Locals blocked the highway seeking action against the driver.

85.title: Oscar-winning actress Juliette Binoche cuts her hair in support of Iranian women
85.article_body: Oscar-winning French actress Juliette Binoche cut her hair in support of Iranian women protesting the death of Mahsa Amini after her arrest by Iranian morality police for allegedly not wearing hijab properly. In an Instagram video, she and some other actresses were seen cutting their hair. "In solidarity for freedom rights for Iranian women and men," Juliette captioned the video.

86.title: Pakistan's General Bajwa meets US Defense Secretary at Pentagon
86.article_body: Pakistan's Chief of the Army Staff, General Qamar Javed Bajwa, met US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin in the Pentagon on Tuesday. General Bajwa thanked the US for extending help to flood-affected Pakistan. General Bajwa's visit to the US comes weeks before he is set to retire. The Pakistani government is yet to announce General Bajwa's successor.

87.title: Protesters disrupt UK PM Truss’ speech at Conservative Party meet
87.article_body: Liz Truss' first speech as UK Prime Minister at the annual conference of the Conservative Party was interrupted by Greenpeace protesters in Birmingham on Wednesday. During Truss' speech, two female protesters stood up, holding a banner which read, "Who voted for this?", referring to Truss becoming the party leader last month. The protesters were escorted out by security personnel.

88.title: 2 try to smuggle ₹68.45 lakh-gold at Hyd airport in separate incidents
88.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in separate incidents and gold worth ₹68.45 lakh was recovered. In one incident, a male passenger arriving from Bangkok tried to smuggle 865.6 grams of gold worth ₹46.05 lakh. In another incident, a woman tried to smuggle 435 grams of gold worth ₹22.40 lakh.

89.title: PM Modi blows traditional 'Ransingha' during rally in Himachal
89.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his visit to Himachal Pradesh played a Ransingha, a trumpet-like traditional instrument, gifted by CM Jai Ram Thakur on Wednesday. PM Modi then said, "This marks the beginning of each future victory." He addressed a public rally at the Luhnu ground after inaugurating the AIIMS Bilaspur hospital and a hydro-engineering college.

90.title: Burning Ravana effigy falls on spectators at Dussehra event in Haryana; video surfaces
90.article_body: Some people were reportedly injured after a burning effigy of Ravana fell on them during Dussehra celebrations in Haryana's Yamunanagar on Wednesday. A video shows the presence of a massive crowd at the incident site. In the video, people can be seen running as soon as the effigy of Ravana collapses on the ground.

91.title: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya serves food at Durga Puja pandal, shares video
91.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda helped serve food to devotees as she visited a Durga Puja pandal. Sharing a video, she wrote on Instagram, "Subho Bijoya Dashami." In the clip, she can be seen serving chutney and dancing at the pandal. Commenting on the post, her mother Shweta Bachchan Nanda wrote, "I'm sure you made Deedu...so happy."

92.title: KKR to buy TPG Capital stake in Manipal Health Enterprises: Report
92.article_body: US private equity giant Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co LP (KKR) is in an advanced stage of negotiations to buy out the stake of TPG Capital in Manipal Health Enterprises, Moneycontrol reported quoting sources. This comes over a month after KKR reportedly sold its 27.5% stake in Max Healthcare hospital chain for over ₹9,000 crore in August.

93.title: Kerala police officer suspended from duty over alleged links with PFI
93.article_body: A Kerala police officer has been suspended over his alleged links with Popular Front of India (PFI), authorities confirmed. An order issued by the Ernakulam (rural) District Police stated that the concerned police officer tried to meet PFI activists under custody at Perumbavoor police station without the permission or knowledge of his superiors. Centre has banned PFI for five years.

94.title: Javed Akhtar, I know you to be feminist: Sona on #MeToo accused Sajid
94.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra questioned lyricist Javed Akhtar's silence over #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation. "Dear Javed, I know you to be a veteran, feminist and thought leader of the Indian film industry...you choose to...remain silent all these years about these men you know...well," she tweeted. Sona added she's hurt by Javed's silence and it breaks her heart.

95.title: Want to be in 'Mahabharat', Karna's character appeals to me: Saif
95.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that he would like to act in 'Mahabharat' if it is made like 'The Lord of the Rings'. "We've been talking about that with Ajay Devgn since 'Kachche Dhaage' in our generation, it's the dream subject," he added. Saif added Karna's character in 'Mahabharat' is "more appealing" to him. Saif plays Raavan in 'Adipurush'.

96.title: GST collection in Punjab crosses ₹10,000-crore mark for first time in H1 FY23
96.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said the state's GST collection crossed the ₹10,000-crore mark for the first time in the first six months of FY23. Punjab has seen a 22.6% YoY growth in GST collection so far in FY23, Cheema added. Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government had estimated a total GST collection of ₹20,550 crore for FY23, he said.

97.title: Wrote to you about ₹6,000-cr MCD scam, you didn't pay heed: Sisodia to L-G
97.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has accused L-G VK Saxena of not ordering an investigation into an alleged ₹6,000-crore scam in Delhi's municipal body that Sisodia claimed he'd written to Saxena about. "You got CBI raids conducted at my house...[and gained] nothing," he added. This comes after Saxena said a probe will be conducted on AAP's power subsidy scheme.

98.title: 24-yr-old delivery rider lies about being robbed in Delhi; arrested
98.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery rider was arrested for allegedly hatching a conspiracy about being robbed in Delhi's Neb Sarai, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he was held at gunpoint and was robbed of ₹31,000, a police official said. The accused hatched the plan after delivering a phone in Neb Sarai, DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary said.

99.title: Cholera disease is making an unwelcome comeback: WHO
99.article_body: The WHO's Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday said, "Another disease making an unwelcome comeback is cholera." He added, "In the first 9 months of this year, 27 countries have reported cholera outbreaks." He also said that the data shows the average case fatality rate so far this year is almost three times the rate of the past five years.

100.title: Madhya Pradesh board Class 10 & 12 exams to be held from Feb 15
100.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education (MPBSE) has announced that the Class 10 and 12 board exams will be held from February 15 to March 20, 2023. The state School Education Department said that the complete schedule will be available to students soon. The exam dates were shared by School Education Department on its official Twitter handle.

101.title: 36-yr-old Divya Nettimi world's first woman to start a $1-billion hedge fund
101.article_body: US-based Divya Nettimi has started her own hedge fund Avala Global with over $1 billion in commitments, making it the largest launch of a woman-led firm in the industry, Bloomberg said. The 36-year-old portfolio manager earlier oversaw over $4 billion at Viking Global Investors. She'll be betting on and against stocks in the consumer, technology, business services and telecom sectors.

102.title: NEP 2020 aims at creating global citizens: Dharmendra Pradhan
102.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said the National Education Policy (NEP) is not only for the Indian society but its implementation would create global citizens for the 21st century. Inaugurating an international conference of Indian School Psychology Association in Puducherry, he said that NEP envisages the vision of stalwarts like Aurobindo, Mahatma Gandhi and Swami Vivekananda.

103.title: DMK taking credit for projects started during AIADMK rule: EPS
103.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday accused the DMK government of taking credit for projects introduced during his rule. "The current government, since the day it assumed charge, has been functioning in a lethargic manner," Palaniswami said. "The AIADMK government announced 11 medical colleges and a law college, but the DMK government took credit...[by] inaugurating it," he added.

104.title: Man cuts birthday cake with machete in TN, held after video surfaces
104.article_body: The Coimbatore Police have arrested four people for cutting a cake with a machete. The incident came to light after a video of the incident went viral on social media. In the video, a man can be seen cutting the cake with the machete, while his friends sing and wish him. The incident took place on September 25, reports said.

105.title: Shinde quotes Harivansh Rai Bachchan to claim Bal Thackeray's legacy
105.article_body: Ahead of his Dussehra rally, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde tweeted Harivansh Rai Bachchan's couplet to claim the legacy of Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray. The tweet read, "My son, being my son will not be my heir, whoever will be my heir, will be my son." Shinde and Bal Thackeray's son Uddhav Thackeray are heading rival factions of Shiv Sena.

106.title: Iranian singer, who supported female protesters, released on bail
106.article_body: Shervin Hajipour, an Iranian singer who was recently jailed for one of his songs in support of the ongoing protests in the country, was released on bail on Tuesday. Hajipour's song 'Baraye' had received millions of views on Twitter. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police.

107.title: Allahabad University students protesting fee hike burn PM Modi's effigy
107.article_body: Students of the Allahabad University in Uttar Pradesh burnt effigies of PM Narendra Modi and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan while protesting against fee hike on the occasion of Dussehra on Wednesday. The protesting students have alleged that the fees have been increased by almost 400 times for undergraduate courses.

108.title: US govt paid SpaceX to send Starlink terminals to Ukraine: Report
108.article_body: SpaceX was paid by US government to send Starlink terminals to Ukraine, despite the firm denying any help from the US government, The Washington Post reported. US Agency for International Development (USAID) reportedly edited an earlier press release to remove value of SpaceX's donation in "public-private partnership" that sent terminals to Ukraine. It also removed number of terminals SpaceX sent.

109.title: Election Commission may need a Model Code of Conduct: Kapil Sibal
109.article_body: Senior lawyer Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said the Election Commission of India (ECI) may need a Model Code of Conduct. The Rajya Sabha MP made the remarks after the ECI proposed changing the model code so that political parties provide information on the financial viability of their poll promises. The parties were asked to submit their views on the matter.

110.title: Passengers, staff play garba at Bengaluru airport, videos go viral
110.article_body: Videos of passengers and staff playing garba at the Bengaluru airport last week have gone viral on the internet. Dressed in traditional attires, the staff formed a circle and danced as travellers joined them. Many users said Dasara should also be celebrated at the airport, in accordance with Karnataka's culture.

111.title: Offering jobs on compassionate grounds is a concession, not right: SC
111.article_body: The Supreme Court has observed that offering employment to people on compassionate grounds is a concession aimed at helping crisis-ridden families but it shouldn't be considered a right. The SC made the observation while setting aside a lower court's order, which directed that the respondent woman be appointed for a state government job on compassionate grounds after her mother's death.

112.title: 'What wrong did he do with anyone?' Mother of deceased J&K DG Prisons
112.article_body: The mother of Jammu and Kashmir DG Prisons Hemant Lohia, who was found dead on Monday night, on Wednesday asked, "What wrong did my son do with anyone?" The accused, identified as Yasir Ahmed, first suffocated Lohia to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

113.title: 2 MPs, 5 MLAs from Thackeray-led Shiv Sena to join Shinde camp today: MP
113.article_body: Two MPs and five MLAs from the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction will join the camp headed by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde at the Dussehra rally today (Wednesday), MP Krupal Tumane said. Tumane, who is part of the Shinde group, claimed the two MPs could be from Mumbai and Marathwada. The Shinde group will celebrate Dussehra at Mumbai's MMRDA Ground.

114.title: Number of dog-bite cases fell by more than half in B’luru: BBMP
114.article_body: The number of dog-bite cases have reduced significantly in Bengaluru, from 42,818 cases in 2019 to 17,610 cases in 2021, according to data of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). This year from January to July, 11,291 such incidents were recorded. Most cases this year were recorded from BBMP South Zone, followed by East Zone.

115.title: Trips to US would upset me, a H'wood actor said 'You speak English really well': Deepika
115.article_body: Deepika Padukone, speaking to Business of Fashion magazine, opened up about racial stereotypes in Hollywood. "It'd upset me every time I went to...US," she stated. "I met [this actor]...he said 'Hey...you speak English really well'...When I came back I said, 'What do you mean you speak English really well?' Did he have...notion that we don't speak English?" Deepika added.

116.title: Mother warned to not get into controversy with women in Bigg Boss: MC Stan
116.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant MC Stan revealed his mother has "warned" him to not get into any controversies with women in the show. "She...told me not to raise my hands as that could lead to me getting ousted," he added. "While I'm a happy-go-lucky person, if someone does test my patience, I don't know how will I react," he stated.

117.title: Meta settles lawsuits with 2 firms scraping data from its platforms
117.article_body: Meta has settled lawsuits with Israel-based BrandTotal and US-incorporated Unimania for a "significant sum", Meta said. The two firms were engaged in scraping data from Meta's Facebook and Instagram. They agreed to a permanent injunction, banning them from scraping Facebook and Instagram data or profiting from the data they've already collected. Meta had filed the lawsuits in October 2020.

118.title: 1-minute talk with Rajinikanth about 'Ponniyin...' made my year: Jayam
118.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and revealed that he is overwhelmed after Rajinikanth praised him for his performance in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "That one-minute conversation made my day, my year and added a whole new meaning to my career. Thank you Thalaiva for your kind words and childlike enthusiasm," Jayam further tweeted. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam.

119.title: I don't want to work in Bollywood: Mandana after #MeToo accused Sajid Khan joins Bigg Boss
119.article_body: Talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', actress Mandana Karimi said it makes her "feel sad". She added she doesn't want to work in Bollywood. "I don't want to be involved with an industry where there's no respect for women," she stated. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

120.title: You have 50 mins until your life changes: Nobel Committee to winner at 1:53 am
120.article_body: The Nobel Prize Committee called Stanford University Professor Carolyn Bertozzi at 1:53 am to inform her about her win. "You have 50 minutes to collect yourself and wait until your life changes," the Nobel Committee told her. Carolyn, Morten Meldal and Karl Barry Sharpless jointly won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry.

121.title: Man beaten with sticks, mother attacked for honking at cows in Guj
121.article_body: A man was assaulted with sticks and his mother was attacked in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for honking at cows sitting in the middle of the road. The owner of the cows got offended, called other men from his community and smashed the victims' car windows. The accused also threatened to kill him if he spoke about the incident, reports said.

122.title: Fire breaks out in storage unit in Mumbai, no casualties reported
122.article_body: A fire broke out in a storage unit near a high-rise building in Mumbai's Andheri area on Wednesday morning. A video showed a huge cloud of smoke rising from the small structure, where bamboos and wood were reportedly stored. An official said three fire trucks and a tanker controlled the flames and there were no injuries or casualties.

123.title: Fine of ₹66,000 collected in drive against unfit vehicles in Navi Mumbai
123.article_body: Navi Mumbai's Vashi Deputy Regional Transport Office (RTO) penalised unfit vehicles during a week-long special campaign and collected a fine of ₹66,000 from 222 vehicles. "We conduct such a drive to ensure...motorists keep their vehicle fit and carry out a regular check to prevent breakdown," an official said. A total of 485 vehicles, including rickshaws, trucks and buses, were inspected.

124.title: Hyd to see light to moderate rain till Sunday, yellow alert issued
124.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Hyderabad city will likely be receiving light to moderate rainfall and thundershowers until October 9. The weather department has also issued a yellow alert for the city for Thursday, October 6. Meanwhile, civic officials cautioned the public to be alert in view of the rain.

125.title: India's sugar export brings record ₹40,000 crore during 2021-22 season
125.article_body: Indian producers exported a record 109.8 Lakh Metric Ton (LMT) of sugar worth ₹40,000 crore in 2021-22. India produced a record 5,000 LMT of sugarcane worth over ₹1.18 lakh crore between October 2021 and September 2022. Out of the total production during the period, about 3,574 LMT was crushed by sugar mills, and 359 LMT of sugar was produced.

126.title: Man harasses woman after engagement breaks off in Delhi; arrested
126.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stalking and harassing a woman by posting her morphed pictures from a fake Facebook account in her name after their engagement broke off, police said on Wednesday. The accused even posted her mobile number on the profile and portrayed her as a sex worker, a senior police officer said.

127.title: RBI plans to use artificial intelligence for improved regulatory supervision
127.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is planning to use artificial intelligence, advanced analytics and machine learning to analyse its database and improve regulatory supervision on banks and Non Banking Financial Companies. For this purpose, RBI is looking to hire external experts. The bank is already using artificial intelligence and machine learning for supervisory processes.

128.title: Sisodia & Kejriwal are 'twin towers of corruption' in Delhi: BJP
128.article_body: BJP workers on Thursday burnt effigy of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government to protest against corruption in the national capital. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said, "BJP has decided to burn the effigy of corruption on Dussehra to protest against AAP grafts." "This is an effigy of...corruption by Kejriwal and Sisodia. They are the twin towers of corruption," he added.

129.title: Kazakhstan rejects Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian ambassador
129.article_body: Kazakhstan has rejected Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian diplomat, Petro Vrublevskiy, in Astana and instead asked Kyiv to replace him over comments on killing Russians. Vrublevskiy said in an interview "the more Russians we kill now, the fewer...our children will have to kill". Kazakh Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, said Vrublevskiy will leave Kazakhstan once new diplomat comes.

130.title: 2 men get 3 years in prison for beating up minor, his uncle in Thane
130.article_body: A Thane court sentenced two men, Sachin Daulat Bere and Viki Vishnu Bere, to three years of imprisonment for beating up a minor and his uncle over a dispute in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹20,000 each on the accused. Pravin Satpure was playing cricket in the locality when the quarrel took place, additional public prosecutor said.

131.title: Govt entitled to levy GST and excise duty on tobacco: Karnataka High Court
131.article_body: The Karnataka High Court dismissed petitions of tobacco manufacturers, ruling that the government is entitled to impose both Central GST (CGST) and excise duty on tobacco and tobacco-derived products. The court said that the levy of excise duty is a matter of public policy and the CGST itself contemplates levy of excise duty upon tobacco and tobacco products.

132.title: Savita, 1st Indian woman to climb Mt Everest & Makalu in 16 days, dies in U'khand avalanche
132.article_body: Savita Kanswal, first Indian woman to climb Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in 16 days, was among those killed when an avalanche struck a group of trainee mountaineers and instructors from Nehru Institute of Mountaineering in Uttarakhand’s Uttarkashi on Tuesday. The 26-year-old was an instructor at the institute and had scaled Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in May this year.

133.title: 34-year-old Tamil TV actor Lokesh Rajendran dies by suicide
133.article_body: Filmmaker and Tamil television's 34-year-old actor Lokesh Rajendran, best known for his work as a child artist in the serial 'Marmadesam', died by suicide in Chennai on Tuesday. "I came to know there was some misunderstanding between Lokesh and his wife. Legal notice for divorce came from his wife four days ago," his father said. "Lokesh was depressed," he added.

134.title: Middle East, North Africa world's fastest-growing crypto markets: Report
134.article_body: Middle East and North Africa (MENA) are the world's fastest-growing crypto markets, with the volume of crypto received in the region jumping 48% between January-June 2022, Chainalysis said in a report. MENA was followed by Latin America, with a 40% growth rate, and North America, recording 36% growth. Turkey topped the MENA region in terms of value of crypto received.

135.title: Shinde faction supporters used yet-to-be-opened Samruddhi Expressway: Cong MLA
135.article_body: Maharashtra Congress MLA from Jalna, Kailash Gorantyal, claimed that members of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction used the yet-to-be-opened Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway. Around 100 vehicles of rebel Shiv Sena leader Arjun Khotkar's supporters used the expressway, he said. The expressway will cover the 701-km distance between Mumbai and Nagpur, and is touted to be India's fastest expressway.

136.title: Hrithik said 'You need to stop apologising' as I kept giving retakes: Rohit
136.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said he kept apologising for giving retakes as he was nervous to shoot for a scene. "After we finished the scene, Hrithik sir took me aside," he added. Rohit said, "Hrithik told me, 'You need to stop apologising for not getting something right. We are all trying to make ourselves better over here on set'."

137.title: OYO's valuation falls in private market after markdown by SoftBank: Report
137.article_body: Valuation of IPO-bound OYO fell to around $6.5 billion in the private market after its investor SoftBank cut the hospitality and travel-tech firm's valuation in its private books, PTI reported. Nearly 12.3 lakh shares of OYO were sold in the private market between September 26-30, against 1.6 lakh sold between September 19-23. Softbank had cut OYO's valuation by 20%.

138.title: Where's population imbalance if Hindus & Muslims have same DNA: Owaisi
138.article_body: After RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored and called for a population control policy, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "For Mohan, it's annual day of dog whistles." "If Hindus and Muslims have 'same DNA' then where's 'imbalance'? There's no need for population control," Owaisi said. "Muslims have sharpest decline in fertility rate," he added.

139.title: Delhi Zoo launches Animal Adoption Scheme; to cost ₹6 lakh/yr for adopting lion
139.article_body: Delhi's National Zoological Park has launched Animal Adoption Scheme to let the general public, firms and institutions adopt its animals. According to a circular, the adoption cost ranges from ₹700/year for a zebra finch bird to ₹6 lakh/year for a lion or a tiger. Adopter's name/company's logo will be displayed on a signage in front of the adopted animal's enclosure.

140.title: Mexican President denies spying on critics after Pegasus allegations
140.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has denied that his administration spied on journalists or opponents after reports emerged that phones of two journalists and a human rights activist were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021. On Tuesday, Mexico's Defence Ministry said it does not carry out intelligence activities, much less espionage, against human rights defenders.

141.title: Will induct 2,000 members on Dussehra to fight 'demonic mentality': AAP
141.article_body: AAP's Gujarat President Gopal Italia on Wednesday said that it would induct nearly 2,000 members on the day of Dussehra to "combat demonic mentality". Among those inducted on Wednesday was Hardik Barot, who was the Vice President of the Congress' Gandhidham unit. Barot joined AAP in the presence of its state election in-charge, Gulab Singh Yadav.

142.title: He has not fitted into any role: Ajay Jadeja on Pant's form in T20Is
142.article_body: Talking about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's form in T20Is, former cricketer Ajay Jadeja said the 25-year-old has not "fitted into any role" in the format. "The Indian team has moved on to role-playing acts...that's where Pant has lost out...With that role-play that DK is doing, it works," stated Jadeja. Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last 15 T20I innings.

143.title: PM Modi participates in Dussehra Rath Yatra in Kullu, thousands gather; video surfaces
143.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in Dussehra Rath Yatra during International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. Photos from the event showed thousands of people attending the International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu. Notably, this is the first time that the Prime Minister of the country is participating in the Kullu Dussehra celebrations.

144.title: SoftBank CEO didn't pitch Arm investment to Samsung in Seoul: Report
144.article_body: SoftBank Group Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son, who is on a visit to Seoul, on Tuesday discussed long-term cooperation between chip designer Arm and Samsung Electronics. However, he didn't propose Samsung to invest in its subsidiary, Arm, according to a local media report. Son had earlier said that he'd like to talk with Samsung about a "strategic alliance with Arm".

145.title: AIIMS Bilaspur will be known as 'Green AIIMS', it's eco-friendly: PM
145.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, PM Narendra Modi said the hospital is eco-friendly and will be known as "Green AIIMS". The hospital will increase access to affordable healthcare in the state, PM Modi added. He said Himachal has played a crucial role in "rashtra raksha" and now with AIIMS Bilaspur, it'll play a pivotal role in "jeevan raksha".

146.title: SEBI imposes 5-year market ban on Gautam Thapar in CG Power case
146.article_body: CG Power and Industrial Solutions' former Chairman Gautam Thapar and three other entities were imposed a five-year ban and fine by the Securities and Exchange Board of India for diversion of funds and misrepresentation of the company's financial statements earlier. SEBI also penalised a total of 11 entities, including KN Neelkant, Atul Gulatee, Aditya Birla Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank.

147.title: H'yana CM reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
147.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Wednesday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram to check on the health of former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted there. "Met with [his] family, his son Akhilesh Yadav. Wishing for his quick recovery. Doctors say there is an improvement, but full recovery will take time," Khattar said.

148.title: Adani Enterprises announces 2 new subsidiaries
148.article_body: Adani Enterprises has announced the creation of a wholly-owned subsidiary Adani Disruptive Ventures (ADVL) along with another subsidiary Alwar Alluvial Resources (AARL), a stock exchanges filing said. Jeet Adani, Vice President of group finance for the Adani Group is a part of the core team of ADVL. Alwar Alluvial Resources will be engaged in the manufacturing and processing of minerals.

149.title: HDFC Bank reports 23.5% jump in loans in Q2, highest in over 3 yrs
149.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 23.5% year-on-year surge in loan advancements to ₹14.8 lakh crore in the September quarter. This is its highest loan growth in more than three years or 14 quarters. Advances grew 25.8% from last year, including inter-bank participation certificates and rediscounted bills. Deposits for the September quarter increased 19% to ₹16.73 lakh crore.

150.title: Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag Kansara has passed away: Sunil Pal
150.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal took to social media to share a video wherein he revealed that comedian Parag Kansara has passed away. "Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag is no more...I've no idea what's happening to the comedy world...Just few days ago...we had lost Raju Srivastava." Parag was one of the six contestants in first season of The Great Indian Laughter Challenge.

151.title: Who are the only 5 people to win the Nobel Prize twice?
151.article_body: American chemist Karl Barry Sharpless, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday, and in 2001, is the fifth individual to be awarded two Nobel Prizes. Besides him, Nobel Prize laureates John Bardeen, Marie Skłodowska-Curie, Linus Pauling and Frederick Sanger have won two Nobel Prizes each. Curie became the first person to receive two Nobel Prizes in 1911.

152.title: India's stand on Ukraine-Russia war shows we're being heard: Bhagwat
152.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that India's stand during the Ukraine-Russia conflict showed the country was being heard. "We're becoming more and more self-reliant on the national security front as well," he said. "Bharat's importance and stature have increased in the community of nations. In the sphere of security, we are becoming more and more self-sufficient," he added.

153.title: Hyderabad Police bust red sanders smuggling gang, 500 kg wood seized
153.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with Forest Department officials busted an interstate red sanders smuggling gang and seized 500 kg wood worth ₹75 lakh from them, police said. Four persons were arrested and one accused is currently absconding. The main accused, Shaik Abdullah, reportedly incurred losses in real estate and decided to smuggle red sanders, police stated.

154.title: Indian Oil, BPCL plan oil deals before sanctions on Russian crude: Report
154.article_body: State-owned refiners are looking to lock-in more of their crude supplies in term deals amid concerns over tighter Western sanctions, including from the EU on Russian crude, Reuters reported. Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum are seeking term deals with countries, including the US. "We're preparing for a backup...world is uncertain because of Russia-Ukraine conflict," an official said.

155.title: 46% CEOs globally planning job cuts, 39% freeze hiring: KPMG report
155.article_body: With signs that the Great Resignation could be cooling down, 39% of CEOs have implemented a hiring freeze and 46% are considering downsizing their workforce over the next six months, according to the eighth edition of KPMG 2022 CEO Outlook. The report also mentioned that three-year view is more optimistic with only 9% CEOs are expecting a further reduced headcount.

156.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for 2 days, shows ICC's data
156.article_body: As per ICC's data, India batter Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for two days. He achieved top rank with 854 rating points after overtaking Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan on October 2 and remained on top position on October 3 as well. However, he slipped to second position after scoring 8(6) against South Africa in third T20I on Tuesday.

157.title: Uber asks employees to work from office twice a week from Nov 1
157.article_body: Uber has asked employees to work from the office twice a week. It announced Tuesdays and Thursdays as "anchor days", wherein all non-remote employees must work from the office globally, starting November 1. Earlier, Uber allowed staff to work from anywhere as much as half the time, but now they can work remotely for up to four weeks per year.

158.title: WI going to be struggling for a long time: Ex-WI player Winston Benjamin
158.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Winston Benjamin has criticised their current management, stating that they don't even have the "quality" to be picking a side that would compete at the international level. "We are going to be struggling for a long time," he added. Earlier in August, WI lost two T20I series at home, first against India and then against New Zealand.

159.title: Elections to be held in J&K after voters’ list compilation: Shah
159.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said elections will be held in J&K with "full transparency" as soon as work of compiling the voters’ list is completed. Furthermore, he said manner in which delimitation has been done in the region, representatives of the people’s choice will be elected. The Union Home Minister was addressing a public rally in Baramulla.

160.title: Credit Suisse's Deputy Head of wealth management in Asia resigns
160.article_body: The Deputy Head of Credit Suisse's Asia-Pacific wealth management business Young Jin Yee has resigned. This development comes at a time when the shares of Switzerland's second-biggest bank touched a new record low after declining 12% on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

161.title: Chiranjeevi says he wasn't satisfied with 'Lucifer', Mohanlal fans react
161.article_body: At GodFather's pre-release event, Chiranjeevi said he "wasn't completely satisfied with 'Lucifer'". The statement received reactions from Mohanlal fans. A fan tweeted, "'Lucifer' movie is classic, nobody can come near it," while another fan called the statement "really unprofessional and arrogant". Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi fans are calling 'GodFather' his "great comeback" after Acharya's failure.

162.title: Congress, NCP to support Uddhav's candidate in Andheri East bypoll
162.article_body: Congress and NCP extended support to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction's candidate in the bypoll for Andheri East Assembly seat. Congress' Nana Patole said his party firmly stands with Shiv Sena and will not field any candidate. The bypoll was necessitated after Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke's death. Shiv Sena has decided to field Latke's wife Rutuja.

163.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd for Durga idol immersion on Oct 6
163.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for immersion of Durga idols in Hussain Sagar lake on Thursday, October 6. Traffic will be diverted at NTR Marg and People's Plaza on Necklace Road from 4 pm till the immersion concludes. Traffic coming from Ambedkar statue will not be allowed towards NTR Marg and will be diverted towards Iqbal Minar.

164.title: MCD signs deal with Lajpat Nagar traders’ body over sanitation of market roads
164.article_body: MCD has signed an agreement with the Traders Association Lajpat Nagar, where the traders' body will take care of sanitation and sweeping services of six-kilometre roads in and around the marketplace. Cleaning of roads will be done using a mechanised machine, which will reduce the dust factor from the roads, Traders Association Lajpat Nagar (TALN) General Secretary Ashwani Marwah said.

165.title: Russian TV journalist who protested invasion says she escaped house arrest
165.article_body: Russian TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who staged an on-air protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, confirmed she had escaped house arrest. Ovsyannikova was put under a two-month house arrest in August over a protest in which she called Russian President Vladimir Putin a murderer. "I refuse to comply with...restraint imposed on me...and release myself from it," she said.

166.title: Violence against Muslims is treated as justice in PM's new India: Owaisi
166.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the violence in Gujarat's Kheda during Navratri celebrations, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that "every day there is more evidence of mass radicalisation". "Floggings and mob violence by police have become common. Targeted violence against Muslims is treated as 'justice'. This is the reality of Modi's Vishwaguru/New India/5G/$5 Trillion Ton economy," Owaisi said.

167.title: Delhi woman cheats 25 people of over ₹1 cr in kitty scheme; arrested
167.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a 52-year-old woman, a resident of Delhi's Dwarka, for allegedly cheating her neighbours of over ₹1 crore by running a kitty. She cheated over 25 people by inducing them to invest money and promising to return matured amount within 15 months. She shifted to an unknown place after the maturity period passed.

168.title: I make the money, my mother Soni Razdan handles it: Alia Bhatt
168.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that her relationship with money is that she makes it and her mother Soni Razdan handles it. "I'm not sure how much money I have in the bank...I do sit with my team and have an idea...I know my mother is handling it very well," she added. Alia recently featured in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

169.title: If Shami is to replace Bumrah, then he should've played Asia Cup: Aakash
169.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has criticised the Indian management over Mohammad Shami's omission from recent tours and the 2022 Asia Cup. "Jasprit Bumrah missed the tour to West Indies and Asia Cup...and if Shami [is] indeed the best option to replace Bumrah...then he should have been a part of the Asia Cup at the very least," wrote Aakash on Twitter.

170.title: No call for ransom yet: Relative of Indian-origin family abducted in US
170.article_body: There has been no call for ransom till now, said a relative of the Indian-origin family that was abducted in US' California on Monday. "[The family's] car was found burnt 20-25 kilometres away from their office. Their mobile phones have been found," the relative, who lives in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, said. US authorities have reportedly released a potential suspect's photo.

171.title: Pune civic body starts drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters
171.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters. "In the past few days, we've confiscated properties of 21 citizens who failed to pay their tax. Of these 21, 12 defaulters came forward and have so far paid ₹93 lakh in arrears," an official said. PCMC has decided to seize over 1,300 properties in total.

172.title: Ukraine forces approach borders of Luhansk Oblast that Russia annexed: UK
172.article_body: UK has said Ukrainian soldiers have advanced up to 20 km beyond the Oskil river in northeastern Kharkiv towards Luhansk Oblast.
