"Russian leaders will...be concerned that leading Ukrainian units are approaching the borders of Luhansk Oblast, which Russia claimed to have annexed," UK Defence Ministry said. Russia formally annexed four regions of Ukraine on Wednesday.

173.title: White.Inc raises $1 mn in round led by Dholakia Ventures, others
173.article_body: White.Inc﻿ has raised $1 million in funding led by Dholakia Ventures, which also saw the participation of Inflection Point Ventures and FirstPort. Other participants in the round included angel investors Suhail Sameer and Shashvat Nakrani from BharatPe, Gunavanth Vaid from 4G Capital Ventures and Aniket Gore from Ceramet Group. White.Inc was founded by Siddharth Gadodia and Young Yun in 2021.

174.title: Previous govts laid stones, forgot completing projects after polls: PM in Himachal
174.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally, said development in Himachal Pradesh is possible as people have voted BJP to power. "Previous governments used to lay stones and forget about completing projects after polls, but our government lays stones and inaugurates projects," PM Modi added.

175.title: No talks with Pakistan; Modi govt won't tolerate terrorism: Shah
175.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah ruled out holding any dialogue with Pakistan. He said, "Some people say we should talk to Pakistan. Why should we talk to Pakistan? We will not talk. We will talk to the people of...Kashmir." He added that PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government does not tolerate terrorism.

176.title: 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar rescued: MEA
176.article_body: India on Wednesday said that it has rescued around 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar. The information was shared by the spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs, Arindam Bagchi. More Indians have been rescued and are in the custody of Myanmar authorities, Bagchi said, adding that legal formalities for their repatriation have begun.

177.title: Civilian killed in accidental firing, policeman arrested: J&K Police
177.article_body: A 25-year-old civilian, Asif Ahmad, was killed after a policeman's service rifle went off at a checkpoint in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Wednesday, said police. SHO Zafar Ahmad said it was a misfire. The victim was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed. The policeman was arrested and his weapon was seized, said police.

178.title: Protesting teachers climb atop water tank in Punjab, threaten self-immolation
178.article_body: Demanding jobs as physical training instructors (PTI) in government schools for a year now, two teachers climbed a water tank in Mohali protesting against the Punjab government and threatened self-immolation. AAP government is giving false assurance to us, said one of the protesting teachers. Last year, five teachers staged a similar protest by climbing atop a water tank in Mohali.

179.title: Former Haryana MLA Anil Dhantori quits Congress
179.article_body: Anil Dhantori, a former MLA from Shahbad assembly segment of Haryana's Kurukshetra district, left Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Dhantori said that he is resigning from the party's primary membership and from the post of National Media Panelist (Spokesperson) of Congress. Sharing the letter on Twitter, Dhantori wrote, "Farewell Congress." He represented Shahbad from 2009 to 2014.

180.title: Congress loses chair of Parliamentary panels on IT, Home
180.article_body: Congress leaders have been removed as heads of parliamentary standing committees on Home Affairs and Information Technology. Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor, who headed the IT committee, has been replaced by Prataprao Jadhav, a Shiv Sena MP from the Eknath Shinde faction. Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi has been replaced by BJP MP Brij Lal as Home Affairs committee chairman.

181.title: Michael Bevan picks 3 teams as favourites to win 2022 T20 World Cup
181.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Michael Bevan has picked India, England and Australia as his favourites to win the 2022 T20 World Cup. Bevan, however, added, "Given the home ground advantage (for Australia), it should help [them] a little bit." Notably, India recently defeated Australia 2-1 in their three-match T20I series. Australia had won the 2021 T20 WC after defeating New Zealand.

182.title: Co-founder & strategy head of bankrupt crypto firm Celsius steps down
182.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius' Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer, S Daniel Leon has stepped down, the company said on Tuesday. The announcement comes a week after the company's CEO Alex Mashinsky resigned from his position. In July, Celsius had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, a month after pausing withdrawals, citing extreme market conditions.

183.title: Bertozzi, Meldal, Sharpless win Chemistry Nobel for click chemistry, get ₹7.45-cr prize
183.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Chemistry has been awarded to Carolyn R Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K Barry Sharpless. They have been awarded the prize for the "development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry". For their Nobel win, they will get 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.45 crore) prize money.

184.title: Woman traces snatcher using smartwatch in Gurugram, gets phone back after hitting him
184.article_body: A woman in Gurugram, using her smartwatch, tracked a man for about three hours and took back her mobile that he had snatched from her in a market. She told the police that he snatched her phone while she was performing a UPI transaction. When she spotted him, she hit him on his head and later approached the police.

185.title: IT Minister drops made-in-India smartphone to test its strength
185.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who attended the recently-concluded digital technology forum India Mobile Congress (IMC), intentionally dropped a made-in-India smartphone to test its strength. In a video of the event's highlights shared by the minister, he was seen dropping the phone to the ground. IMC, the largest digital technology forum in Asia, was held from October 1-4 in Delhi.

186.title: Unknown caller issues life threats to Mukesh, Nita Ambani; Mumbai Police probes
186.article_body: An unknown person called on the landline number of Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday and issued life threats to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani. The caller also issued threats to Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani and Anant Ambani and threatened to blow up the hospital. "Investigation in this matter is being done," Mumbai Police said.

187.title: 3 arrested after viral video shows them beating a dog in B'luru
187.article_body: Three men were arrested in Bengaluru after a purported video of them beating a dog went viral on social media. The three men thrashed the dog with wooden canes for barking at them the previous day, reports said. The dog's owner, who filmed the incident, was pushed by the accused when he tried to intervene.

188.title: Default electricity subsidy extended in Delhi, to continue till Oct 31
188.article_body: Delhi government has extended the default electricity subsidy by one more month, till October 31. Now, consumers who failed to opt-in for the subsidy till September 30, will get free electricity up to 200 units and 50% subsidy on the consumption of below 400 units in October also. From November, only those who opt for it will get the subsidy.

189.title: If Raavan's from Lanka, he shouldn't look like Mughals: Dipika on 'Adipurush'
189.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who played Sita in the show 'Ramayan', opened up about Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in 'Adipurush'. "A film's characters must appeal to the audience. If the character is from Sri Lanka, they should not look like Mughals," she stated. 'Adipurush' was trolled on Twitter over its VFX and Saif's look after the teaser was released.

190.title: PM's governance model brings employment, Gupkar model offers guns: Shah in J&K
190.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a public rally in J&K's Baramulla on Wednesday, said that PM Narendra Modi's model of governance brings development and employment. "The Gupkar model offers stones and guns in hands of the youth," Shah added. "There is a lot of difference between [PM] Modi's model and Gupkar model," Shah stated.

191.title: Over 200 fall sick In Gurugram society, water contamination suspected
191.article_body: Over 200 residents of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 72 have fallen sick in the past two days with vomiting and diarrhoea, prompting the health department to look into complaints of suspected water contamination. The concerned officials said that they have collected water samples for examination and a report will be out soon.

192.title: Emerson to sell part of assets to Blackstone for up to $10 bn: Report
192.article_body: Emerson Electric is in talks with US buyout firm Blackstone to sell a part of its commercial and residential solution business assets, Bloomberg reported. The deal's value could be between $5 billion-$10 billion and would depend on the assets Emerson decides to sell. This comes after Emerson announced an $11-billion merger of its software units with Aspen Technology last year.

193.title: 30-year-old motorcyclist killed by 3 men in road rage in Ahmedabad
193.article_body: Three men allegedly killed a 30-year-old motorcyclist in a case of road rage in Ahmedabad. The incident took place on Monday after the three men going on a motorcycle asked the other motorcyclist to stop for nearly hitting their bike. Inspector YJ Rathod of Meghaninagar police said all three men are aged between 20 and 25 years.

194.title: CCTV footage shows dog carrying human skull in Navi Mumbai; probe on
194.article_body: A human skull was found near a company premises in Mahape, Navi Mumbai, on Tuesday. CCTV footage in the premises showed a dog carrying the skull three days ago. Rabale MIDC Police said the skull was completely burnt. They've launched an investigation to ascertain whether a body has been dumped anywhere or the dog brought the skull from a crematorium.

195.title: No charge for using RuPay credit card for UPI transactions up to ₹2,000: NPCI
195.article_body: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Tuesday said there'll be no charges on use of RuPay credit cards on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) for transactions worth up to ₹2,000. As per an NPCI circular, UPI apps would ensure complete transparency on transactions using a credit card. The step has been taken to encourage wider acceptance of RuPay cards.

196.title: When you leave Mannat, SRK opens the car door for you: Riteish Deshmukh
196.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh has said that the most special thing about a get-together in Shah Rukh Khan's residence Mannat is its host. "Whenever you are leaving, SRK would come with you to your car and open the door of the car for you," he added. Riteish further revealed that dinner in such get-togethers is served at 3 AM.

197.title: Andhra doctor requests India to save his pet jaguar and panther from Ukraine
197.article_body: An orthopaedic doctor from Andhra Pradesh, who was based in Ukraine when the war with Russia broke out, has appealed to Indian government to help rescue his pet jaguar and panther. Dr Gidikumar Patil was forced to leave them behind with a local farmer when he left Ukraine for Poland. Dr Patil said he gets depressed thinking about the cats.

198.title: Wanted to become journalist, was huge Barkha Dutt fan: Hina Khan
198.article_body: Hina Khan said she "wanted to become a journalist" and was a huge Barkha Dutt fan, but "destiny had some other plans". She revealed that her friends "kind of forced" her to audition for 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai'. "I got selected in the first round, then they asked me to come to Bombay... and I started shooting," she said.

199.title: Russian Prez Putin signs bills to formally annex 4 regions of Ukraine
199.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday completed the formal annexation of more than 15% of Ukraine. Putin has signed bills admitting the Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions into Russia. Earlier, the annexation legislation was unanimously passed by both houses of the Russian Parliament. The formalities followed after referendums were held in the four regions amidst the war.

200.title: Makers wanted Sridevi to do an item song: 'English Vinglish' director
200.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde shared that the producers she initially approached for the 2012 film wanted Sridevi to do an item song. "I said I would rather put the film aside and not make it. Then Balki (R Balki, filmmaker-husband) decided to produce it ourselves," she said, adding that 'English Vinglish' was "the toughest thing" to be made.

201.title: Religion-based population imbalance can't be ignored: RSS chief
201.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored, adding that India needs a comprehensive population control policy which applies to all "equally" for the next 50 years. "Alongside the differences in birth rate, conversions by force, lure or greed and infiltration are also big reasons," he said.

202.title: Pet cat in US breaks world record for being the tallest living domestic cat, pics surface
202.article_body: A pet cat named Fenrir Antares Powers, which lives in US' Michigan, has been confirmed by the Guinness World Records as the world's tallest living domestic cat. Fenrir measures 47.83 cm (18.83 in). Fenrir is the brother of Arcturus Aldebaran Powers, who formerly held the record before passing away. Arcturus measured in at 48.40 cm (19.05 in).

203.title: Can't doubt experts' wisdom: Delhi HC rejects PIL against NEET answer key
203.article_body: Delhi High Court has rejected a plea of a 2022 NEET-UG candidate who challenged the final answer key of the exam and claimed that some answers provided in it were incorrect. However, NTA, which checked the NEET papers, said the answer key was created after consultation with medical experts. The court said, "[Law]...doesn't permit...to doubt the wisdom of the experts."

204.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in Bengaluru today; issues yellow alert
204.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru on Wednesday and issued a yellow alert for several districts of Karnataka. The meteorological department also said that other districts near Bengaluru like Kolar, Chikkaballapur and Bengaluru Rural are also likely to get light showers. A yellow alert has also been issued for Chitradurga and Davanagere districts.

205.title: Waqar Younis missed 1992 WC in Aus, but Pak still won: Ajay Jadeja on Bumrah
205.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said India shouldn't have a problem without Jasprit Bumrah in the upcoming T20 World Cup as they've done well in many matches without the pacer this year. Jadeja also cited Pakistan's 1992 WC win, stating that Pakistan won the title that year without Waqar Younis, who had also been ruled out due to an injury.

206.title: Woman kills husband with lover's help in UP, stages it as suicide
206.article_body: A 32-year-old woman having an affair allegedly strangled her husband to death with her lover's help in UP's Raebareli. The accused, Shubha and Sumair, are said to have hung the victim's body from the ceiling to make it look like suicide. They even planted a suicide note, the handwriting on which matched with that of Sumair's, according to police.

207.title: US military aid to Ukraine increases risk of clash with West: Russian envoy
207.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, said that Washington's decision to send more military aid to Ukraine poses "an immediate threat" to Moscow's strategic interests. "The supply of military products by...US and its allies not only entails protracted bloodshed and new casualties but also increases the danger of a direct military clash between Russia and Western countries," he added.

208.title: Gurugram man's phone stolen after suspects see him put ATM card inside phone cover
208.article_body: A man's mobile phone was allegedly stolen by two men who saw him put his ATM card inside the phone cover while he was coming out of an ATM in Gurugram's MG Road. The suspects caught the man while he was walking towards DLF Phase-II and snatched his phone. Later, they withdrew ₹50,000 and made UPI transactions using the card.

209.title: Solomon Islands PM to visit Australia amid tensions over pact with China
209.article_body: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare will visit Australia on Thursday. The visit comes six months after the Pacific island nation signed a security pact with China under which Beijing was permitted to send forces in order to "maintain social order". Sogavare and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese last met in Fiji at the Pacific Islands Forum in July.

210.title: People panic as ballistic missile fired by South Korea crashes
210.article_body: A ballistic missile, which was fired by South Korea in response to North Korea's launch of a ballistic missile over Japan, crashed. The crash caused panic among nearby residents who thought they were under attack from North Korea. The South Korean military said the warhead of the missile did not explode.

211.title: I told Babar if he wants me to play, I'll play, I'm available: Shoaib Malik
211.article_body: Veteran Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who hasn't been picked in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup, has said he's available for selection and will play if captain Babar Azam wants him to play. "I have always been available for Pakistan and I still am," said Shoaib in an interview. Shoaib last played for Pakistan in November 2021.

212.title: Icahn amassed Twitter stake worth $500 mn in the last few months: WSJ
212.article_body: Activist investor Carl Icahn acquired a Twitter stake worth more than $500 million in the past few months and benefited from Elon Musk deciding to go ahead with his Twitter deal on Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal reported. The estimated profit for Icahn Enterprises could exceed $250 million as Twitter shares jumped 22% to $52 on Tuesday.

213.title: Russia discusses continuing space station participation beyond 2024
213.article_body: Russia is internally discussing continuing its participation in the ISS beyond 2024. Head of human space programs at Roscosmos Sergei Krikalev admitted that a new Russian station may not be ready by 2025. "We know that it's not going to happen very [quickly], so probably we will keep flying [on the ISS] until we have any new infrastructure," he added.

214.title: Russia praises Musk's proposal for Ukraine war, says it's 'very positive'
214.article_body: Russia's spokesman Dmitry Peskov welcomed Elon Musk's proposal for the Ukraine war, saying, "It's very positive that somebody like...Musk is looking for a peaceful way". "Musk is still searching for ways to achieve peace. And achieving peace without fulfilling Russia's conditions is...impossible," he added. Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany, Andrij Melnyk had slammed Musk over the proposal.

215.title: Centre plans 18 ropeway projects, new ropeways likely in Ujjain, Srinagar
215.article_body: The Centre is planning to start work on 18 ropeway projects across India totalling about 90 km in the next few months. A ropeway will likely be made to reach Srinagar's Shankaracharya temple, another one to Leh Palace and one up to Gwalior Fort. Centre has also invited tenders for construction of a two-kilometre-long ropeway to Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain.

216.title: Telangana CM KCR launches national party, names it Bharat Rashtra Samithi
216.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday launched his national party and named it Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) at Telangana Bhavan. KCR also renamed Telangana Rashtra Samithi as Bharat Rashtra Samithi. The decision to rename TRS as BRS was taken in the general body meeting earlier on Wednesday morning.

217.title: Money or VFX won't make a film Ramayan: Mukesh Khanna on 'Adipurush'
217.article_body: Commenting on Adipurush's teaser, Mukesh Khanna said only "VFX or investing ₹100- ₹1,000 crore" cannot make a film Ramayan. "Pardon me for saying it straight, but the film will not work," he said. Mukesh added, "I warn rich people - don't use your money to change our rituals, religion or epics. If you wish to, try it with other religions."

218.title: After iPhones, Apple to produce some AirPods, Beats headphone in India: Report
218.article_body: Apple is reportedly asking its suppliers to move some AirPods and Beats headphone production to India for the first time. As per a report, Luxshare Precision Industry, which already produces AirPods in Vietnam and China, plans to help Apple make AirPods in India. Notably, Apple recently announced its plans to manufacture the latest iPhone 14 in India.

219.title: A quality Tamil historical film after years: Shankar on 'Ponniyin Selvan'
219.article_body: Director Shankar said 'Ponniyin Selvan' is a "quality Tamil historical film", which has "yet again proven" Mani Ratnam's "mastery in filmmaking". He called AR Rahman's music "riveting" and praised Ravi Varman's "picturesque" cinematography. "Full three hours intrigue you for the sequel. Hail to the vast army that made this epic," he tweeted.

220.title: UP power official suspended after sharing posts against PM, Yogi
220.article_body: A Sub-Divisional Officer (SDO) in the electricity department of UP's Mau has been suspended after he shared posts against PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath on social media. His posts targeted PM Modi on issues like demonetisation, a probe found. According to an official, Radha Krishna Rao also had multiple complaints filed against him for misbehaving with consumers.

221.title: Indian Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh; 1 pilot dies, another injured
221.article_body: A Cheetah helicopter of the Indian Army crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Wednesday morning, killing a pilot and injuring another, said the Army. The helicopter crashed in a forward area near Tawang during a routine sortie, the Army added. Both pilots were evacuated to the nearest military hospital but Lieutenant Colonel Saurabh Yadav, who was critically injured, died during treatment.

222.title: IPL auction wasn't on mind, was just trying to score after 2 ducks: Rossouw
222.article_body: Talking about his maiden T20I hundred in their match against India on Tuesday, South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw said the IPL auction was not on his mind as he was just trying to score runs after consecutive ducks in his last two innings. Notably, Rossouw last played in the IPL in 2015. The 32-year-old slammed 100*(48) in the match.

223.title: Amit Shah chairs security review meeting with officials in J&K
223.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday chaired a security review meeting with senior officials in J&K's Srinagar. The Home Minister is currently on a visit to the Union Territory. J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and other senior officials including J&K DGP Dilbag Singh and top officials of the Army were present at the meeting.

224.title: Dargah razed in Porbandar, Section 144 imposed in various parts
224.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in various parts of Gujarat's Porbandar after the district administration demolished Muradsha Pir Dargah during a drive against encroachment. The police fired tear gas to prevent a mob marching towards the site. A Gujarat Waqf Board official said they received a notice on September 29 but were not given sufficient time to respond.

225.title: New Zealand's Reserve Bank hikes rates by 50 bps to a 7-year high
225.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) on Wednesday hiked interest rates by 50 basis points to a seven-year high as the country grapples with inflation. "Core consumer price inflation is too high and labour resources are scarce," RBNZ Governor Adrian Orr said. This is the fifth such large-sized move and the eighth rate hike in 12 months.

226.title: India to depart for T20 World Cup 2022 without their 15th player
226.article_body: India will be leaving for T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia in less than 24 hours with around 18 players in their contingent, but without the official 15th player of the squad. Talking about Jasprit Bumrah's potential replacement, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We've got to get someone in who's got experience...I don't know who that guy is yet."

227.title: Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express travel time revised from today
227.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) has further reduced the travelling time of the newly-introduced Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express train with effect from Wednesday. According to Western Railway's release, the Vande Bharat Express will take five minutes less to cover the distance from Mumbai Central to Gujarat's Gandhinagar and will also arrive 20 minutes early at Mumbai Central from Gandhinagar.

228.title: OPEC+ may cut oil output in Wednesday's meet amid clashes with US
228.article_body: OPEC+ is looking to cut oil output during Wednesday's meeting even as the US is pushing the nations to not proceed with the cut amid rising gasoline prices. OPEC+, which includes Saudi Arabia and Russia, is reportedly planning on cuts in excess of 1 million barrels per day. On Tuesday, Brent crude rose by 3% above $91/barrel.

229.title: Avenue Supermarts' Q2 standalone revenue jumps 35.8% to ₹10,385 cr
229.article_body: Avenue Supermarts, the operator of DMart retail stores, posted a 35.8% year-on-year surge in revenue from operations to ₹10,384.7 crore for the quarter ended September. The standalone revenue in Q2 FY23 nearly doubled as against the pre-COVID-19 period of Q2 FY20. Its shares closed at ₹4,476.50 apiece on the BSE on Tuesday, up 1.15% from the previous day's close.

230.title: Women are taken for granted even today: Madhuri Dixit
230.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said that women are taken for granted even today, but there's "a lot of improvement" in the patriarchal society. Talking about the female representation in films, Madhuri said actresses are no more "slotted into stereotypes" and are "not just props". Crediting writers for the change, Madhuri said, "It's a great time to be in the industry."

231.title: US calls for UN meeting on North Korea missile launch, China & Russia oppose
231.article_body: The US along with Britain, France, Albania, Norway and Ireland urged the UN Security Council (UNSC) to meet after North Korea fired a ballistic missile over Japan. However, China and Russia told council counterparts that they oppose a public meeting, diplomats said. The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called the missile launch a "reckless act", UN spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric said.

232.title: RSS invites woman chief guest at its event for the 1st time in history
232.article_body: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh invited a woman for the first time in its history in the form of mountaineer Santosh Yadav as the chief guest at the annual RSS Vijayadashami festival. The festival was inaugurated by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. Yadav is the first woman in the world to scale the Mount Everest twice.

233.title: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti claims she is under house arrest, police deny
233.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said while Union Home Minister Amit Shah is on a visit to J&K, she has been placed under house arrest to prevent her from visiting north Kashmir's Pattan. However, Srinagar Police said no restriction was put and "she's free to travel". Mufti said Baramulla SP informed her that she won't be allowed to travel to Pattan.

234.title: PM Modi inaugurates AIIMS Bilaspur constructed at cost of ₹1,470 crore
234.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh constructed at a cost of more than ₹1,470 crore. Himachal CM Jairam Thakur, Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP president JP Nadda were also present during the inauguration. AIIMS Bilaspur has 18 speciality and 17 super speciality departments, and 750 beds with 64 ICU beds, PM's office said.

235.title: Amazon freezes hiring for corporate roles in its global retail business: Report
235.article_body: Amazon is freezing hiring for all corporate roles in its global retail segment, as per a report. Over 10,000 openings were posted in that division, accounting for the bulk of Amazon's sales. Amazon instructed recruiters to close all open job postings for those roles in the coming days. "We expect to keep adjusting our hiring strategies," said an Amazon spokesperson.

236.title: Deepika Padukone attends Louis Vuitton show in Paris, pics surface
236.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday attended Louis Vuitton's show at the Paris Fashion Week. In the photos shared by her fans on social media platforms, Deepika was seen seated in the front row of the show with Hollywood stars such as Ana De Armas, Alicia Vikander and others. The show was organised at the Louvre.

237.title: Fire breaks out at hospital in Agra; building owner, son and daughter die
237.article_body: At least three persons were killed after a fire broke out at a building with a private hospital in the Shahganj area in Uttar Pradesh's Agra on Wednesday morning, police said. The building owner, his son and daughter died in the fire, police added. Notably, two other persons were injured and are out of danger, police further said.

238.title: Traffic restrictions, diversions in Noida, Ghaziabad today for Dussehra
238.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police have announced vehicular restrictions and diversions in parts of the city today amid Dussehra events in Noida's Sector 21A stadium and Sector 62. The police have asked commuters to take alternate routes and six cranes have been arranged to tackle vehicle breakdowns. Meanwhile, Ghaziabad Traffic Police have announced traffic diversions on Delhi-Meerut road and GT road.

239.title: Over 2 lakh mobilised into Russian Army in 2 weeks: Defence Min
239.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said over 2,00,000 people have been conscripted into the country's army since President Vladimir Putin announced a mobilisation drive on September 21. The Kremlin has called the mobilisation "partial" and said it aims to recruit 3,00,000 men to fight in Ukraine. Tens of thousands of men have fled Russia to avoid the military call-up.

240.title: Woman who hugged elderly men to steal valuables in Mumbai arrested
240.article_body: A woman who used to hug elderly men to steal valuables such as jewellery and phones from them in Mumbai has been arrested, said police. The accused, Geeta Patel, usually targeted old men out on walks alone or those travelling in auto-rickshaws, said police. She used to ask for a lift and then seduce them to steal valuables, added police.

241.title: We need to empower women with freedom of making decisions: RSS chief
241.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that a society can't progress without women. "We need to treat women with equality and empower them with freedom of making their own decisions," Bhagwat said at a Dussehra event in Maharashtra's Nagpur. "It is imperative to give women independence to work and equal rights in all spheres," he added.

242.title: US President Joe Biden to celebrate Diwali at White House, calls it 'important event'
242.article_body: US President Joe Biden has plans to celebrate Diwali at the White House this year, his spokesperson Karen Jean-Pierre said. "We don't have a date to share with you at this time but it's an event that he thinks is very important as he sees a partnership with India as well as Indian Americans here in this country," Karen added.

243.title: No matter how much Rohit denies it, our death bowling is a big issue: Karim
243.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim has said no matter how much Rohit Sharma tries to deny but India's death bowling is a "big issue". He added, "It's posing a lot of headaches to the management and to Rohit...So, they need to work this out as soon as possible." Earlier, Rohit had admitted they haven't bowled well at the death in recent matches.

244.title: Eijaz Khan and Pavitra Punia get engaged, actor shares pics
244.article_body: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Eijaz Khan has got engaged to TV actress Pavitra Punia. Khan posted a series of photos on Instagram showing Pavitra Punia's response to his proposal. He wrote, "Baby, if we keep waiting for the right time, It's never gonna be, I promise you my best, Will you marry me? She said 'yes'."

245.title: Maharashtra's ration card holders to get grocery package at ₹100 for Diwali
245.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet announced Diwali package for ration card holders under which it will provide groceries at ₹100. The package will contain one kilogram of each rawa, chana dal, oil, sugar and a litre of palm oil. This package will be distributed via e-pass system and fund of ₹486.94 crore has been sanctioned for this, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said.

246.title: OnePlus Nord Watch goes on sale on Amazon's Great Indian Festival
246.article_body: The recently launched OnePlus Nord Watch is now available on Amazon Great Indian Festival sale, priced at ₹4,999, with selected bank offers. The smartwatch sports 1.78-inch AMOLED display, 60Hz refresh rate, 105 sports modes and features monitoring multiple health indicators. Available in Deep Blue and Midnight Black, it claims 10-day battery life with up to 30 days of standby time.

247.title: Coldplay postpones Brazil shows owing to Chris Martin’s lung infection
247.article_body: Coldplay announced on Twitter that they are postponing their upcoming shows in Brazil due to Chris Martin's "serious lung infection". A note shared on the social media platform read that Chris has been put "under strict doctor's orders to rest for the next three weeks". The band informed that the shows will now happen in early 2023.

248.title: 25-yr-old beaten to death over suspicion of tyre theft in Delhi, 2 held
248.article_body: A 25-year-old man was beaten to death by three others in Delhi's Alipur area over suspicion of tyre theft, following which two of the accused were arrested, police said. The victim's body was dumped near a farmhouse, police added. "There were tattoos on the man's neck and hands...had multiple injuries on his chest, head, back and legs," police further said.

249.title: Liverpool, Bayern register wins, Inter beat Barca in Champions League
249.article_body: Liverpool and Bayern Munich registered wins in their respective group matches, but Barcelona faltered 0-1 against Inter Milan on Tuesday night in the Champions League. It's Barcelona's second straight loss in the tournament after a 0-2 defeat against Bayern in their last Group C game. Meanwhile, Napoli recorded their third straight win after a 6-1 victory against 10-man Ajax.

250.title: H&M launches its festive collection with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign
250.article_body: H&M India announced the launch of its festive collection, comprising of western wear and home décor, with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign. The collection radiates a vibrant colour palette featuring a range of blazers, dresses, tops, skirts, pants and accessories designed for celebration, H&M stated. It will be available in-stores, on H&M website and app, and on Myntra from October 5.

251.title: Pune Police busts robbery gang, arrests 6 persons
251.article_body: The Pune Police on Tuesday said they busted a robbery gang and arrested six persons. The police also claimed to have recovered 584 kg brass and copper worth ₹2.47 lakh from Lonikand. It was revealed during interrogation that the accused stole electric pumps and transformers, and sold copper and brass for profit, according to police.

252.title: Ex-German Chancellor Merkel wins UNHCR award for resettling refugees
252.article_body: Former German Chancellor Angela Merkel has won the United Nations Refugee Agency's (UNHCR) Nansen Refugee Award for welcoming more than a million refugees, mostly from Syria, into Germany. "It [the award] recognises her moral and political courage in helping more than a million refugees rebuild their lives," Filippo Grandi, UNHCR chief said. Merkel will also get $150,000 prize money.

253.title: US consulate in Hyd to auction vehicles, iPhones, furnitures, other items
253.article_body: US consulate in Hyderabad is going to conduct an online auction for four-wheelers, two-wheelers, IT equipment and several other items. The auction will take place on Accurate Auctioneers portal and it will begin at 10 am on October 12. The inspection of vehicles that will be auctioned can be done on October 11 from 9 am to 3 pm.

254.title: MSRTC suspends woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels on duty
254.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) suspended a woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels and Facebook videos wearing her uniform during duty hours. It said it was against service rules and amounted to misconduct. The conductor, Mangal Giri, has over one lakh followers on both Instagram and Facebook. Her colleague who shot the videos is also facing action.

255.title: Celebrities call out Kanye West for 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week
255.article_body: After Kanye West wore a 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week, Jaden tweeted, "Black Lives Matter." Rapper Boosie tweeted, "Damn @kanyewest you just going to keep using your platform to s**t on your own race like this?...Do us a favour and bleach your skin all white." Supermodel Linda Evangelista wrote, "Black. Lives. Matter. Today, fashion made me sad."

256.title: Man, his 3 aides arrested for daylight murder of 35-yr-old woman in K'taka
256.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested a man and his three aides for allegedly murdering a 35-year-old Muslim woman in Gadag in daylight on the road. Initially, it was reported the murder was a hate crime as she had converted to Islam. Police later clarified that the man, along with his friends, had decided to kill the woman to avenge his brother's murder.

257.title: Tesla to remove more sensors from cars amid autopilot scrutiny
257.article_body: As Tesla faces autopilot scrutiny, it will only use cameras in its safety and driver-assistant features and will remove ultrasonic sensors from vehicles starting this month. As of now, Tesla vehicles have 12 ultrasonic sensors on the front and rear bumpers along with short-range sound sensors that are mainly used to detect close objects and while parking.

258.title: Can you buy Twitter & then delete it: Musk's ex-wife Talulah to him in a text
258.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's text messages with his ex-wife and actress Talulah Riley regarding Twitter have also become public. In one of the messages dated March 23, Talulah wrote to Musk, "Can you buy Twitter and then delete it, please!?" In another, she wrote, "Please do something to fight woke-ism...I will do anything to help! xx."

259.title: 78-yr-old man marries 18-yr-old girl in Philippines; pics go viral
259.article_body: A 78-year-old man in the Philippines has married an 18-year-old girl, with pictures from the ceremony going viral on social media. Rashed Mangacop met Halima Abdullah three years ago at a dinner party in the Cagayan province. "It was not an arranged marriage and the couple came together purely out of love," Rashed's nephew, Ben Mangacop, said.

260.title: Wonderful piece of art: Nagarjuna on Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'
260.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna congratulated Mani Ratnam for 'Ponniyin Selvan' and called the film a "wonderful piece of art". "'Ponniyin Selvan' had always been his dream. He had talked about it to me quite a few times," Nagarjuna said. The actor added that he's seen Mani Ratnam's journey as a filmmaker and recalled his "fond memories" of working with him in 'Gitanjali'.

261.title: Tracxn Technologies fixes price band at ₹75-₹80 for October 10 IPO
261.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for its initial public offering. Tracxn's IPO will be open for subscription from October 10-12 and comprise an offer for sale of 3,86,72,208 equity shares by promoters and shareholders. Tracxn Co-founders Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh will offload up to 76,62,655 equity shares each.

262.title: 2 friends drown in Hyderabad's Nanajipur waterfalls, bodies recovered
262.article_body: Two friends who went for a picnic at Nanajipur waterfalls located near Hyderabad’s Shamshabad drowned on Monday. The incident took place when 30-year-old Kammari Mahendhar Chary and his 19-year-old friend Md Nadeem entered the water to swim, Shamshabad police said. Later, with the help of expert swimmers, police retrieved their bodies.

263.title: Ugandan Prez fires son from military role after Kenya invasion tweet
263.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni fired his son, Muhoozi Kainerugaba, as commander of the country's infantry forces after his son tweeted that it wouldn't take him and his army two weeks to capture Kenya's capital Nairobi. However, Uganda's military said that Kainerugaba has been promoted from Lieutenant General to full general and would remain a senior presidential adviser for special operations.

264.title: Felt like setting my younger self free: Lil Nas X on wearing skirt at a show
264.article_body: Singer Lil Nas X said he felt like he was setting his "younger self free" when he walked on the stage of one of his shows wearing a skirt. "Afterwards, my family...told me they were really proud. I feel like I'm changing some minds," he added. The singer said style is "a way to show people who you are".

265.title: Delhi man, held last year, arrested again with 300 kg banned firecrackers
265.article_body: Police arrested a 43-year-old man in possession of 300 kilograms of illegal firecrackers in Delhi's Shyam Vihar area. "It was also revealed...the same person was arrested last year in the same season while selling the banned firecrackers," police said. "The accused disclosed...he had procured firecrackers from Gurugram and was selling at higher rates to earn huge profit," police added.

266.title: Police raid illegal parking lot in Gurugram Sector 48, 2 booked
266.article_body: The Gurugram Police and Chief Minister's flying squad booked two people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot during a joint raid in Sector 48. The parking lot was being run by encroaching on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) land. The CM's flying squad has identified at least 20 places in Gurugram where groups are running illegal paid parking lots.

267.title: India reports 2,468 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 33,318
267.article_body: India reported 2,468 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country stand at 33,318. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,733. This comes a day after India reported 1,968 cases, the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May.

268.title: I think the way Karthik batted, my no. 4 is in trouble: Suryakumar
268.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik for his 46-run innings, which included four boundaries and as many sixes, in the third T20I against South Africa, Suryakumar Yadav said, "The way he batted, my number four is in trouble." Chasing South Africa's 228-run target, India lost Rohit and Shreyas early in the game and Karthik was promoted to bat at number four.

269.title: 4 terrorists killed in 2 encounters in J&K's Shopian: Police
269.article_body: Four local terrorists were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted on Wednesday. In the first encounter that broke out in the Drach area, three terrorists linked with Jaish-e-Mohammed were killed, said police. In the second encounter that took place in the Moolu area, one terrorist linked with Lashkar-e-Taiba was killed, added police.

270.title: There's no official candidate, says Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential polls
270.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential polls, party leader Shashi Tharoor said it's quite unfair to create an impression that there is an "official candidate". "The party President and former President have assured me that there isn't and they are neutral," Tharoor added. "I don't know why some people are trying to create such an impression. It's not fair," he stated.

271.title: Ex-US marine jailed for 4.5 years in Russia for drunken attack
271.article_body: A former US Marine has been reportedly sentenced to four-and-half years in a Russian penal colony for attacking a police officer while drunk. Police removed Robert Gilman from a train following complaints from fellow passengers in January. He was then arrested for kicking an officer while in custody. Gilman said he has "apologised to Russia" and the police officer.

272.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performs 'Shastra Puja' on Dussehra, video surfaces
272.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performed 'Shastra Puja' at Auli Military Station in Chamoli, Uttarakhand on the occasion of Dussehra. "We're confident that our country is safe in the hands of our armed forces. India is the only country where 'puja' of weapons is performed," he said. Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was also present during the ceremony.

273.title: Rohit bursts into laughter after calling Suryakumar's form a 'big concern', video viral
273.article_body: During the presentation ceremony following the third T20I against South Africa, India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly stated that the form of Suryakumar Yadav, who got out for 8(6), is a "big concern". Rohit then burst into laughter after making the sarcastic statement. "I thought that was least of your concerns," Murali Kartik commented. Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

274.title: I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage: Melinda on divorce with Bill
274.article_body: Melinda French Gates in an interview spoke about her "unbelievably painful" divorce with ex-husband Bill. She said, "I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage anymore…But the odd thing about COVID is that it gave me the privacy to do what I needed to do." They announced their divorce in May 2021, after 27 years of marriage.

275.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in online gift fraud case
275.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in an online gift fraud case by a fraudster claiming to be a doctor in a foreign country, police said. The accused told her he had sent a gift but it had been seized by customs officials, police added. The woman transferred ₹3.23 lakh but never received the gift, police stated.

276.title: Traffic streamlined on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, 3 exits shut near Chipyana ROB
276.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has closed three exits near the newly constructed Chipyana rail overbridge to streamline the flow of traffic on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME). The three exits, present within a distance of about two kilometres, were opened to ease traffic flow when the rail overbridge, which was the last pending structure on DME, was under construction.

277.title: Struggled with bat in 1st T20I, bowling in 2nd, but were clinical in 3rd: Bavuma
277.article_body: After their 49-run win in the third and final T20I against India, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "A win like this is always good for confidence." He added, "We struggled with the bat in the first game, our bowling wasn't best in the last game, but we were clinical today." South Africa's Rilee Rossouw slammed 100*(48) in the game.

278.title: Nitish Kumar came to me begging after losing 2014 LS polls: Prashant Kishor
278.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar went to him "begging" after losing the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. "I assisted him in winning the 2015 Assembly polls as the chief ministerial candidate of the 'Mahagathbandhan'. Today, he has the temerity to offer 'gyan' (wisdom) to me," Kishor added.

279.title: 5 die as 4 cars, ambulance collide on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; video surfaces
279.article_body: At least five persons died following a collision between four cars and an ambulance on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link on Wednesday morning, Mumbai Police said. Earlier, it was reported that 10 persons got injured in the collision. Notably, the ambulance and other vehicles were preparing to take the victims of an earlier accident to a hospital.

280.title: LED TV explosion kills 16-year-old, creates massive hole in house wall in UP
280.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after an LED TV exploded at his house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The explosion, which injured the teen's mother, sister-in-law and a friend, left a massive hole in a wall of the house. "The explosion was so powerful, the entire house shook and parts of the wall collapsed," a family member said.

281.title: PM Modi greets people on Vijayadashami, wishes them positive energy
281.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted people on the occasion of Vijayadashami on Wednesday. "Many congratulations to all citizens on Vijayadashami, the symbol of victory. I wish that this auspicious occasion brings courage, restraint and positive energy in everyone's life," he tweeted. The PM is expected to participate in Kullu Dussehra celebrations in Himachal Pradesh today.

282.title: Crying at 9 am, video conferencing at 10 am: Melinda on working with Bill amid divorce
282.article_body: In an interview, Melinda French Gates spoke about working with Bill Gates amid their divorce. She said, "Even though I might be crying at 9 am and then have to be on a videoconference at 10 am with the person I'm leaving, I [had] to show up and be my best...I learned as a leader that I could do it."

283.title: Finally working with Karan Johar: Sara on 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
283.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is feeling blessed about collaborating with Karan Johar for her upcoming film 'Ae Watan Mere Watan', which was announced on October 4. "After all the magnanimity, friendship, advice, generosity and love - finally working with you, Karan Johar," she wrote.  Karan said he's excited to welcome Sara on board "to tell a powerful true story".

284.title: Imran Khan biggest liar on earth, he ruined country's economy: Pak PM
284.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has accused his predecessor Imran Khan of being "the biggest liar on the face of the earth". Sharif also alleged that Khan's policies had left the country's economy in "ruins". Talking to The Guardian, Sharif also accused Khan of "injecting poison" into society to "dangerously polarise the electorate" after he was ousted from power in April.

285.title: Youth kidnaps 11-year-old girl from Mumbai pandal, rapes her
285.article_body: A 19-year-old youth allegedly kidnapped an 11-year-old girl from a garba pandal in Mumbai and raped her. The victim had gone to the pandal with her sister, who made a quick trip home and when she returned, her sister was missing. The parents approached the police, who tracked down and arrested the suspect. He confessed he sexually assaulted the victim.

286.title: Delhi Police shares similarities between 'Dandiya' and 'Driving' in road safety tweet
286.article_body: A day before Dussehra, the Delhi Traffic Police shared a series of tweets to spread awareness about road safety rules. The traffic police posted an image stating similarities between 'Dandiya' with 'Driving' and shared it saying, "Ae Haalo Re Haalo! Road par GARBAd nahi karo, araam se chalo! (Don’t panic on the road, relax and drive)."

287.title: Bumrah's absence big loss, but also opportunity for someone else: Dravid
287.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has admitted Jasprit Bumrah's absence will be a "big loss" for the side in the T20 WC in Australia. Dravid, however, also added it's an opportunity for someone else to step up. On India's defeat in the third SA T20I, Dravid said, "[Had] Karthik and Pant continued for four-five overs more, it could've been closer."

288.title: Sriti Jha, Kili Paul to enter 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild cards
288.article_body: After Dutee Chand's voluntary exit from 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', the dance reality show will welcome Sriti Jha, Kili Paul, Nishant Bhat, and singer Ada Malik as wild card contestants. However, the Tanzanian social media creator will appear on the show for only a few episodes. Sriti and Nishant were last seen in Rohit Shetty's 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

289.title: 'Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Putin', Zelenskyy tells PM Modi on phone
289.article_body: During a phone call with PM Narendra Modi, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Zelenskyy said that all the aggressor's decisions aimed at attempting illegal annexation of Ukrainian territories do not change reality. He also emphasised the importance of PM Modi's recent statement that now is not the time for war.

290.title: Parts of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday due to repair work
290.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that water supply will be cut off in various parts of the city on Thursday due to repair work. The maintenance work will be carried out at Warje water works, Chandani Chowk water tank, Gandhi Bhavan, SNDT, Swargate etc. Water supply will be restored on Friday with low pressure, added the PMC.

291.title: Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app: Musk
291.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has proposed to proceed with his original offer of $44 billion to acquire Twitter. Soon after, Musk tweeted, "Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app." While he didn't explain what 'X app' could entail, he added, "Twitter probably accelerates X by 3 to 5 years, but I could be wrong."

292.title: Mumbai local trains decorated amid Dussehra, pics surface
292.article_body: String decorations have been put up inside Mumbai local trains amid Dussehra celebrations and commuters shared pictures of the decorated train on social media. Last week, a video of a group of women performing Garba dance aboard a Mumbai local train also went viral on social media. The group of women performed Garba when the train reached Kalyan station.

293.title: Delhi withdraws ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in public
293.article_body: Delhi Disaster Management Authority has withdrawn the order imposing a fine of ₹500 for not wearing masks in public places from October 1. The services of health care workers hired on a contract basis in COVID-19 hospitals have been extended till the end of 2022, it added. Delhi on Tuesday reported 74 COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 1.07%.

294.title: Brad Pitt poured beer on our kids, choked one of them on private jet: Jolie
294.article_body: In a lawsuit filed on Tuesday, Angelina Jolie has alleged that Brad Pitt choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016. Jolie also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

295.title: Twitter confirms receiving Musk's buyout offer, says will close at original price
295.article_body: Twitter confirmed that it has received Tesla CEO Elon Musk's letter for the buyout deal and said it "intends to close the transaction at $54.20 per share", the same price he agreed to in April. Musk's lawyers added that they'll proceed with the agreement if Delaware Chancery Court will "adjourn the trial and other proceedings related to the ongoing lawsuit".

296.title: 25 killed after bus carrying over 40 persons falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
296.article_body: At least 25 persons were killed after a bus carrying a wedding party of over 40 persons fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal on Tuesday night. "Police and SDRF rescued 21 people overnight; the injured have been admitted to nearby hospitals," Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar said. The wedding procession left in bus from Laldhang, Haridwar SP City said.

297.title: US, South Korea fire 4 missiles after North Korea fires missile over Japan
297.article_body: US and South Korea fired four ground-to-ground missiles into the Sea of Japan in response to North Korea firing a ballistic missile over Japan for the first time in five years on Tuesday. The Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles hit mock targets, the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said. South Korea had called North Korea's launch a "provocation".

298.title: 71-yr-old man undergoes robotic-assisted surgery at Navi Mumbai hospital
298.article_body: A 71-year-old man underwent robotic-assisted surgery for treating bladder cancer at Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. The surgery was carried out to remove his urinary bladder and prostate gland. "The advantages of robotically-assisted surgery are that it's minimally invasive and enables high surgical accuracy," a senior doctor at Apollo Hospital said. The man's condition is now stable.

299.title: Hyd Police issue traffic advisory for Durga Visarjan, TRS meet on Wed
299.article_body: Hyderabad Police have issued a traffic advisory for Wednesday. Owing to Telangana Rashtra Samithi meet, citizens coming from Masab Tank towards Banjara Hills Road Number 12 are requested to take alternative routes between 10 am-3 pm. Due to Durga Visarjan in Hussain Sagar from 4 pm, traffic coming from Khairatabad Flyover and Ambedkar statue won't be allowed towards NTR Marg.

300.title: JNU hostel room roof collapses; second such incident in 6 months
300.article_body: The ceiling of a hostel room at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) partially collapsed, making it the second such incident in the last six months. "Although there were no serious injuries to any resident, the residents of the room were sleeping nearby and the ceiling fell directly on their study table," said Swati Singh, President of the Democratic Students Federation (DSF).

301.title: Guard killed in Mumbai for not allowing consumption of alcohol in open plot
301.article_body: A 56-year-old man was arrested for killing a 75-year-old security guard after he refused him permission to consume alcohol in an open plot. The accused used to go to the plot often to consume alcohol but got irked when the victim asked him not to come. The victim and the accused knew each other.

302.title: 27-yr-old Gr Noida man held with 25 cartons of illegal firecrackers
302.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested with 25 cartons of illegal firecrackers in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. The accused had procured them from Delhi and wanted to sell them ahead of Diwali, police said, adding that the accused was arrested while transporting the firecrackers in a pickup truck.

303.title: BJP insulted voters of J&K: NC on Amit Shah's 'family rule' remark
303.article_body: Reacting to Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks about "family rule" in Jammu and Kashmir, National Conference (NC) spokesperson Imran Nabi Dar said BJP's rhetoric is an insult to lakhs of voters. Shah had stated that just three political families have ruled Jammu and Kashmir since independence. "It's unfortunate that this false narrative is being peddled time and again," Dar said.

304.title: Santosh, 1st woman to scale Mt Everest twice, to be chief guest at RSS event
304.article_body: The first woman to scale Mount Everest twice, Santosh Yadav, has been invited by the RSS as a chief guest at its annual Dussehra function in Nagpur on Wednesday. This will be the first time that a woman will be the chief guest at an RSS event, officials said. The Haryana-born mountaineer climbed Everest in May 1992 and May 1993.

305.title: Used car retailing unicorn Spinny launches ESOP for all employees
305.article_body: Used car retailing unicorn Spinny has launched an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) for all its employees. The plan is called 'Spinny Stock Option Plan for All', and will be available to all employees irrespective of role and designation, including blue-collar workers, the company said. In December last year, the Tiger Global-backed startup facilitated an ESOP buyback of $12 million.

306.title: India record their highest 9th wicket partnership in T20I cricket history
306.article_body: India recorded their highest partnership for the ninth wicket in T20I cricket history during the third T20I against South Africa in Indore. Deepak Chahar and Umesh Yadav shared a 48-run stand to set the record. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma and Zaheer Khan, who shared a 36-run stand against Australia in Bridgetown in 2010.

307.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Saturday, list released
307.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states till Saturday. It's very likely over Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha and Telangana on Wednesday and Thursday. It's very likely over Uttar Pradesh till Saturday, while it is likely over Madhya Pradesh till Friday. Andaman and Nicobar Islands may witness it from Thursday to Saturday.

308.title: Stimac to remain Indian men's football team head coach till Asian Cup 2023
308.article_body: Indian football head coach Igor Stimac has extended his contract until the end of the AFC Asian Cup 2023. The AIFF said if India advances to the quarterfinal stage of the tournament, the Croatian's contract will be automatically renewed. "I am extremely happy that the AIFF has placed the trust in the process that we have put in," said Stimac.

309.title: Billing startup Zenskar raises $3.5 mn led by Bessemer
309.article_body: Billing automation startup Zenskar has raised $3.5 million in a seed funding round led by Bessemer Venture Partners. The round also saw participation from Shine Capital, Basecamp Fund and Converge. Zenskar was founded in 2022 by Apurv Bansal and Saurabh Agrawal and it provides a billing software for SaaS companies to handle pricing complexities.

310.title: India's trade deficit widens to $26.72 billion in September, exports fall by 3.5%
310.article_body: According to preliminary data released by the commerce ministry, India's trade deficit widened to $26.72 billion, while exports decreased by 3.52% to $32.62 billion in September 2022. Sectors like engineering, ready-made garments of all textiles and rice saw a decline in exports in September. The merchandise export during the April-September 2022-23 period rose by 15.54% to $229.05 billion.

311.title: Kyrgios seeking assault case dismissal on mental health grounds: Report
311.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios is reportedly seeking to have his assault charge dismissed on mental health grounds. Kyrgios was charged with "common assault" in a "domestic relationship" for a January 2021 incident involving his former girlfriend. In February 2022, Kyrgios said he battled depression and substance abuse around the time of the 2019 Australian Open.

312.title: Tory MPs must unite behind PM Truss: UK's Indian-origin minister
312.article_body: UK's Indian-origin Home Secretary Suella Braverman on Tuesday criticised her Conservative Party colleagues for allegedly plotting a "coup" against Prime Minister Liz Truss. She said Tory MPs should unite behind their leader. Braverman's remarks came a day after the government reversed a proposed cut in income tax rate, following criticism from Conservative Party MPs.

313.title: Ukraine to bid along with Spain and Portugal to host 2030 FIFA WC: Report
313.article_body: Ukraine is reportedly set to join Spain and Portugal in a joint bid to host the 2030 football World Cup. The plan is said to have been sanctioned by Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy along with the governments of Spain and Portugal. The partnership is reportedly set to be announced during a press conference at the UEFA headquarters on Wednesday.

314.title: UP's Ram Baboo breaks national record in men's 35 km race walk
314.article_body: UP's Ram Baboo won the gold medal as he broke the national record in the men's 35 km race walk event at the National Games. Baboo, an unemployed physical education graduate, won the event in 2 hours 36 minutes 34 seconds, beating previous record holder, Haryana's Juned Khan. It is the fifth national record set at the Games so far.

315.title: Congress MLA Harshad Ribadiya resigns ahead of Gujarat polls
315.article_body: Congress MLA and Patidar community leader Harshad Ribadiya resigned from Gujarat Assembly membership on Tuesday. Speaker Nimaben Acharya accepted his resignation after she was convinced that he has resigned on his own and without any pressure, a statement by the state Assembly claimed. Ribadiya was an MLA from Visavadar in Junagadh district. This comes ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections.

316.title: HSBC board looking to sell Canada business: Report
316.article_body: According to a Sky News report, HSBC's board is looking to sell its operations in Canada. The HSBC board had reportedly directed JP Morgan's investment bankers to contact potential purchasers of the bank's domestic operations. According to an analyst, the value of HSBC's Canadian subsidiary could be in the region of $7 billion.

317.title: Piyush Goyal to meet export promotion councils on October 7
317.article_body: An official stated that Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will meet different export promotion councils on October 7 to discuss ways to promote the growth rate in the country's export shipments. Representatives from export bodies, including the Federation of Indian Export Organisations, Apparel Export Promotion Council and Council for Leather Exports, would participate in the meeting.

318.title: Rajasthan govt signs 4,192 MoUs ahead of Invest Summit 2022
318.article_body: The Rajasthan government signed 4,192 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) and Letters of Intent (LoIs), involving investment commitment worth ₹10.44 lakh crore ahead of Invest Rajasthan Summit 2022. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the MoUs and LoIs were signed between November last year and September this year. Out of them, 520 MoUs/LoIs have been executed, while 1,160 are under execution.

319.title: Pak were playing like kids, Eng hit them all over park: Ajmal
319.article_body: After Pakistan lost the series 4-3 against England, ex-spinner Saeed Ajmal said that the former played like "little kids". "England really hit Pakistan all over the park," Ajmal said. He added, "These guys play well in one match and then fail in 10. It's better if you play unfit...players instead...[They] play in fear over their spot in the XI."

320.title: 52-yr-old man killed, another injured in elephant attack in Maha
320.article_body: A 52-year-old man was killed and another man was injured in an attack by a wild elephant in Navegaon Bandh range of Maharashtra's Gondia on Tuesday, a forest official said. The incident occurred when 20 to 25 persons from Tidka village ventured close to a herd of 23 elephants to keep it away from their paddy crop, the official said.

321.title: Pakistani drone spotted in Punjab's Gurdaspur, BSF opens fire
321.article_body: A drone from Pakistan was spotted along the India-Pakistan international border in Punjab's Gurdaspur sector on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, officials said. Border Security Force (BSF) troops opened fire at the object, following which it was reportedly forced to fly back to Pakistan. Officials launched search operations to check if it dropped any packages in Indian territory.

322.title: BillDesk to sue PayU-parent Prosus for terminating $4.7-bn deal: Report
322.article_body: Indian online payments gateway BillDesk is preparing to sue PayU-parent Prosus after it terminated a $4.7-billion acquisition deal, Moneycontrol reported. The deal, which was set to be Indian fintech sector's largest acquisition, was terminated on Monday, nearly a month after CCI approved it. PayU's executives in India were reportedly informed of the termination hours before the announcement.

323.title: ITF working with WTA on 2023 calendar after Swiatek pulls out of BJK Cup
323.article_body: After Iga Swiatek opted to skip Billie Jean King Cup Finals, International Tennis Federation(ITF), world tennis governing body, said it'll work with the women's body(WTA) on 2023 schedule to ensure players can compete in both the events. "ITF is sorry that...Swiatek is unable to take part," said ITF President David Haggerty. The world number one withdrew due to scheduling issues.

324.title: EV startup Euler Motors raises $60M in Series C round
324.article_body: Electric vehicle startup ﻿Euler Motors﻿ said it has raised $60 million in a Series C funding round led by ﻿GIC﻿ Singapore. Blume Ventures﻿, ﻿Athera Venture Partners﻿, ﻿QRG Holdings﻿, ﻿ADB Ventures﻿ and ﻿Moglix﻿ also participated in the round. Euler said the capital will be used to expand its manufacturing and supply chain infrastructure, and accelerate product development.

325.title: Stones hurled at Garba venue in MP; govt razes houses of 3 of 19 accused
325.article_body: Stones were hurled at a Garba event in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur following a dispute between two groups. SP Anurag Sujania said illegal construction, belonging to three of 19 accused, spread over more than 4,500 square feet worth over ₹4.5 crore was demolished. Some accused persons are habitual offenders, Sujania said, adding that seven of them were detained following a probe.

326.title: CESL selects agencies to set up 124 battery swapping stations for EVs
326.article_body: Convergence Energy Services Limited (CESL) said that it has selected agencies to establish 124 battery swapping stations and 352 standing chargers for electric two and three-wheelers. CESL added that the agencies will also install 1,294 standing DC fast chargers for electric four-wheelers. CESL CEO Mahua Acharya said adequate charging infrastructure is a necessity to scale-up electric mobility.

327.title: Bombay Dyeing board approves ₹940 crore rights issue draft
327.article_body: Bombay Dyeing & Manufacturing Company, in a BSE filing, said that its rights issue committee has approved the draft letter of offer for the proposed ₹940 crore. The draft letter of the offer, dated October 3, 2022, will be submitted to the National Stock Exchange of India, Bombay Stock Exchange, and the Securities and Exchange Board of India.

328.title: Grid failure leaves 130 million people without power in Bangladesh
328.article_body: Around 130 million people were without electricity in Bangladesh on Tuesday after a power grid failure, the government said. More than 80% of Bangladesh was affected by the power outage after 2 pm local time, the Power Development Board said. Only some regions in the country's northwest had electricity.

329.title: India suffer their worst-ever defeat on home soil in T20I cricket, lose to South Africa
329.article_body: South Africa defeated India by 49 runs in the third T20I in Indore to hand them their worst defeat (by runs) on Indian soil in T20I history. India's previous worst T20I defeat at home came on March 15, 2016, when New Zealand defeated them by 47 runs in Nagpur. South Africa scored 227/3 today, their highest-ever T20I total against India.

330.title: The more I raped, murdered onscreen, the more I got close to my family: Govvind
330.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said playing negative characters onscreen changed his personality in a good way. "The more I raped, murdered...onscreen, the more I got close to my family," he added. "Because the thought of someone being so cruel used to...trigger me...I used to question myself on how someone can be so bad as to rape or commit...crime," Govvind said.

331.title: I don't associate Ramayan with VFX: 'Ramayan' actress Dipika on 'Adipurush'
331.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who portrayed Sita in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', spoke about the teaser of 'Adipurush' and said, "I don't associate Ramayan with VFX, that's my personal take on this." She added that Ramayan is a story of truth and morality. Directed by Om Raut, 'Adipurush' stars Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan, Kriti Sanon and Sunny Singh.

332.title: Ready to contribute to peace efforts in Ukraine: Modi tells Zelenskyy
332.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a telephonic conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said that India is ready to contribute to the peace efforts in Ukraine. "PM also reiterated the importance of respecting the UN Charter, International Law, and the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all states," as per a statement by the PMO. Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

333.title: Rahul Gandhi condoles death of 10 mountaineers in U'khand avalanche
333.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi offered condolences to the families of those who were killed in an avalanche in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday and called the incident "distressing". "Praying for the safe return of those missing and speedy recovery of those injured," Rahul Gandhi said. Ten trainee mountaineers were killed in the avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak.

334.title: They still look very young: Ayesha on 90s co-stars romancing young actresses
334.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka said in an interview that she doesn't have any problem with the fact that the actors who starred opposite her in the 90s are still romancing women who're in their 20s on the screen. She said they still look very young on screen. "All of them still look like they're 20, so credit goes there," Ayesha added.

335.title: PM Modi condoles death of Vadodara road accident victims
335.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the death of the victims who were involved in a road accident in Gujarat's Vadodara. PM Modi announced ₹2 lakh ex gratia from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) for the family of each of the deceased. He also announced ₹50,000 for those who were injured in the accident.

336.title: 5G launch in India to help other developing economies: Qualcomm CEO
336.article_body: Qualcomm President and CEO Cristiano Amon on Tuesday said that the launch of 5G services in India will be a "catalytic event" in terms of scaling up the technology. He said 5G launch will enable its proliferation in other developing economies across Latin America, Southeast Asia and Middle East. Notably, PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services in India on Saturday.

337.title: Kremlin praises Elon Musk for Twitter poll on Russia-Ukraine war
337.article_body: Russia on Tuesday praised Tesla CEO Elon Musk for suggesting a peace deal in the Russia-Ukraine war. "It is very positive that somebody like Elon Musk is looking for a peaceful way out of this situation," Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Earlier, Musk conducted a Twitter poll with a possible ending of violence.

338.title: People getting liquor from Goa to face MCOCA charges: Maha Minister
338.article_body: Maharashtra Excise Minister Shambhuraj Desai has directed officials of the department to invoke the Maharashtra Control Of Organised Crime Act against people "bringing even one bottle of liquor from Goa". He told the officials to send those smuggling liquor to the police administration. Desai also asked authorities to set up temporary checkpoints on the smaller routes between Goa and Sindhudurg.

339.title: Musk proposes to buy Twitter at the original price of $54.20 a share: Report
339.article_body: The world's richest man and Tesla's CEO Elon Musk is proposing to buy Twitter at $54.20 a share, the original price he proposed for its acquisition, Bloomberg reported. Twitter shares jumped over 12% on the news, after trading was briefly halted. This comes ahead of Musk and Twitter set to enter the courtroom over Musk backing out of the deal.

340.title: Gold-supplying banks cut back shipments to India, focus on China, Turkey: Report
340.article_body: Gold-supplying banks have cut back shipments to India ahead of major festivals in favour of focussing on China, Turkey, and other markets where better premiums are offered, Reuters reported. India's gold imports in September fell 30% from a year ago to 68 tonnes, while Turkish gold imports soared 543%. China's net gold imports via Hong Kong jumped nearly 40%.

341.title: Hope 'Brahmāstra' trilogy will be monetary success for us: Johar
341.article_body: Speaking about the budget of 'Brahmāstra', producer Karan Johar has said that it is a "three-film budget". "There are a lot of assets and properties that were created that will move to film two and then film three," he added. "I'd like to believe...when all three films are made...it'll be a big monetary success for all of us," he added.

342.title: KCR brand ambassador of liquor: Cong after TRS leader distributes liquor, chicken
342.article_body: Congress leader Madhu Yashki on Tuesday criticised the ruling TRS and called Telangana CM KCR a "brand ambassador of liquor". "He not only drinks liquor but is also involved in...liquor scam," Yashki claimed. His comment comes after TRS leader Rajanala Srihari distributed liquor bottles and live chicken to public ahead of launch of a new party by CM KCR.

343.title: Female teachers fight before kids at govt school in UP; video viral
343.article_body: A video showing two-three female teachers getting into a physical fight and abusing each other in front of children at a government school in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur has gone viral on social media. The teachers, who were seen snatching phones from each other, have now been suspended. The incident reportedly took place during Gandhi Jayanti celebrations at Girls' Pre-Secondary School.

344.title: West engaging in nuclear rhetoric right now: Russia
344.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said it does not want to take part in "nuclear rhetoric" which was being spread by the West. UK-based The Times on Monday reported the NATO alliance believed Russia was going to conduct a nuclear test on the Ukrainian border. The West is "engaging in a lot" of "nuclear rhetoric right now", said Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov.

345.title: Edelweiss raises $425 mn for fund, targets $1 bn corpus
345.article_body: Edelweiss Alternative said that it has raised $425 million (₹3,400 crore) for its third 'Special Situations Fund' (SSF III) from large pension funds and insurance companies globally along with domestic high net individuals. The company said that it is targeting a corpus of $1 billion with a greenshoe option of $500 million. The fund has already invested ₹1,000 crore.

346.title: India trade deal may not have everything on services: UK Trade Minister
346.article_body: UK Trade Minister Kemi Badenoch said the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) between Britain and India might not contain everything the services sector wants. Speaking at Conservative Party's annual conference, she said, "We want something comprehensive, but it has to be right for both countries." She said any deal that was agreed upon could also be expanded at a later date.

347.title: Rajasthan BJP Prez starts campaign to open bank accounts for girls
