347.article_body: Rajasthan BJP President Satish Poonia on Tuesday started a campaign to open bank accounts for girls under Centre's Sukanya Samriddhi Account Scheme. Poonia opened bank accounts for nine girls through funds from his salary as MLA. "Sukanya Samriddhi is a flagship scheme of the Modi government and girl children will be benefited from it," he said.

348.title: Saudi Arabia wins bid to host 2029 Asian Winter Games at Neom
348.article_body: Saudi Arabia will host 2029 Asian Winter Games at a planned mountain resort in the Gulf Arab state's $500 billion futuristic city project Neom. Olympic Council of Asia picked the Saudi candidacy that centres on Trojena that's planned to be a year-round ski resort by 2026. "Deserts...mountains  of Saudi Arabia will soon be a playground for Winter sports!" said OCA.

349.title: Bus carrying 45-50 people falls into gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal
349.article_body: A bus carrying 45-50 people fell into a gorge on the Rikhnikhal-Bironkhal road in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal on Tuesday. Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said State Disaster Response Force teams have reached the accident spot and local villagers are helping in the rescue operation. About 10 people have reportedly been injured and search operations are ongoing to find the others.

350.title: TikTok tracks users even if they don't use the app: Report
350.article_body: TikTok tracks people across the web even if they're not users of the app, The Independent reported citing a report by nonprofit organisation Consumer Reports. TikTok receives information including a person's IP address, web browsing habits and search history. The data "isn't used to group individuals into particular interest categories for other advertisers to target", a TikTok spokesperson said.

351.title: Tata Steel sells 19% equity stake in Oman-based mining arm AI Rimal
351.article_body: Tata Steel has sold its 19% equity stake in Oman-based limestone mining company Al Rimal Mining LLC to Oman National Investments Development Company (Tanmia), it informed the exchanges today. With this, Tata Steel's shareholding in its step-down subsidiary Al Rimal has been reduced from 70% to 51%. Other existing shareholders of Al Rimal will also sell their stake to Tanmia.

352.title: B'wood went through tough time with trolling & bashing: Karan Johar
352.article_body: Karan Johar has said that Bollywood went through a tough time with "trolling and bashing". "I, particularly, felt I was right at the centre of so much negativity," he added. Johar stated there were a lot of things written and said about him which was unfair. "It was not a nice time...It was something I never envisaged, imagined," he added.

353.title: Amit Sadh meets 'Entourage' actor Jeremy Piven, shares pic
353.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently met Golden Globe-winning actor Jeremy Piven in the US. Sharing a picture with the 'Entourage' actor on Instagram, Amit wrote, "Jeremy's portrayal of Ari Gold (Entourage) is one of the first few performances that inspired me." "Thank you brother for opening up to me...I cherish stories of your life, which you shared with me," he added.

354.title: BJP a Sultan in Delhi and TRS a Nizam in Hyderabad: Jairam Ramesh
354.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the TRS in Telangana and BJP at the Centre are two sides of the same coin. "If you have a Sultan in Delhi, you have a Nizam in Hyderabad," said Ramesh. He added that the Bharat Jodo Yatra was also a message to the TRS to take the Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS).

355.title: 3 of family, including a police officer, drown in river in Kerala
355.article_body: Three members of a family, including an officer attached with the Special Armed Police, drowned in the Kallar river near Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The deceased, Firoz (31), his brother Abdul (36) and their sister's son Safan (16), lost their lives while trying to save their female relative who drowned first, police said. Later, the locals managed to save the girl.

356.title: Well played my friend: Yuvraj to SA's Rossouw on his 1st T20I ton vs India
356.article_body: Reacting to South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw's maiden T20I century against India in third T20I, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Well played my friend!!! You deserve this moment!!" He added, "Last two games have looked like stick cricket!! 4 6 4. 6 4 6! T20 is getting tough for bowlers in smaller grounds." Rossouw smashed an unbeaten 100 off 48 balls.

357.title: Khalistan Tiger Force operative arrested in Moga with grenades, pistols
357.article_body: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) unit of Moga Police in Punjab arrested an operative of the ISI-backed Khalistan Tiger Force (KTF). Hand grenades, pistols and ammunition smuggled in from Pakistan were recovered from the terrorist. The man is part of a terror module run by Canada-based Arshdeep Singh alias Arsh Dala, a close associate of KTF chief Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

358.title: 90% of all startups fail: Billionaire Anand Mahindra
358.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Over 90% of all startups fail." He explained, "Many fail because of one-off circumstances or because of poor risk management...Yet they had potentially viable models & good tech." He added, "That grey zone is a fertile field for large companies to plough." Recently, Mahindra Logistics acquired logistics startup Rivigo's B2B business for ₹225 crore.

359.title: Remaking a film is more challenging than doing original: Chiranjeevi
359.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi, speaking about 'GodFather', has said that remaking a film is more challenging than working on an original story. "Many of my remakes have earned more than their originals...my characters in those films have brought me great appreciation," he added. Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' is a remake of the 2019 Malayalam film 'Lucifer', which featured Mohanlal.

360.title: Stadium gates too small: Indonesian Police on last week’s stampede
360.article_body: Indonesian Police on Tuesday said the gates at the soccer stadium, where 125 people were killed in a stampede last Saturday, were too small. Only two people could pass through one gate at a time, police said. The probe was focusing on six of the total 14 gates where most deaths were recorded, police said.

361.title: Ukraine's war-torn economy will fall 35% this year: World Bank
361.article_body: The World Bank on Tuesday forecasted that the Ukrainian economy will fall 35% this year amid the ongoing invasion of the country by Russia. The bank expects the Ukrainian economy will return to growth in 2023, expanding by 3.3%. It further estimated that rebuilding Ukraine will cost at least $349 billion, i.e. 1.5 times the size of Ukraine's pre-war economy.

362.title: Chahar abuses Siraj for stepping on boundary line after taking catch, video viral
362.article_body: India pacer Deepak Chahar was spotted abusing Mohammed Siraj after the latter stepped on the boundary line after taking David Miller's catch in South Africa's innings in the third T20I. Siraj's error of judgement brought Miller's third six in a row in the last over of the innings. Miller scored 19*(5) as South Africa put up a total of 227/3.

363.title: Janhvi Kapoor joins Akshay Kumar & Tiger Shroff in 'Bade...': Report
363.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has reportedly been cast alongside Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff in 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'. A source stated, "After contemplating on getting the best possible cast for the script, the team has zeroed in on Janhvi to play the female lead alongside Tiger." The film will be directed by Ali Abbas Zafar.

364.title: IMF to consider Ukraine’s emergency funding appeal: Officials
364.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) will consider Ukraine's appeal for additional emergency funding of $1.3 billion, officials told Reuters news agency. IMF staff believe Ukraine has received enough financial assurances from foreign partners to meet the debt sustainability requirement. If sanctioned, the funds are expected to address food shortages in the country.

365.title: Murali, Tejaswin real icons as they combine both academics, sports: Neeraj
365.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said both long jumper Murali Sreeshankar and high jumper Tejaswin Shankar are the real icons as they have excelled in both sports and studies. "Though I excelled in sports, I couldn't give much attention to my studies...youth of this country should look upon you both," he added. Murali won CWG silver, while Tejaswin clinched bronze.

366.title: Gandhi family neutral regarding Congress Presidential polls: Kharge
366.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday claimed that Gandhi family is neutral regarding the party's upcoming Presidential polls. "Every section of Congress leaders asked me to contest this election. To strengthen the party and to save the Constitution of India, I agreed," Kharge said. Mallikarjun Kharge further said that this is an impartial election.

367.title: UP's Faizabad Cantt to be renamed as Ayodhya Cantt: Report
367.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has reportedly approved changing the name of Faizabad Cantonment in UP to Ayodhya Cantonment. The proposal for the name change came from the state government after last year the Faizabad Cantt railway station was renamed Ayodhya Cantt railway station. Earlier, in 2018, the entire district had been renamed Ayodhya district.

368.title: Kidnapped loan survey firm director rescued in Lucknow, 4 arrested
368.article_body: A 42-year-old director of a loan survey firm, who was allegedly kidnapped by a bank sales executive and his aides, was rescued by Lucknow Police on Monday night. Four persons were arrested in the case. The main conspirator, Ankur Tiwari, and his associates kidnapped the victim with the intention of using the ransom money to expand their business, police said.

369.title: South Africa record their highest-ever T20I total against India
369.article_body: South Africa on Tuesday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against India after registering 227/3 in their 20 overs in the third T20I in Indore. Rilee Rossouw top-scored for South Africa with 100* runs off 48 deliveries. South Africa's previous highest T20I total against India had come on Sunday, when they recorded 221/3 in Guwahati.

370.title: Electronics Mart India's ₹500-crore IPO subscribed 50% on Day 1
370.article_body: The ₹500-crore IPO of Electronics Mart India Ltd was subscribed 50% on the first day of the subscription on Tuesday. Retail investors reportedly subscribed 94% shares of the allotted quota, while the non-institutional investors bought 33% shares of the allotted quota. It received bids for 10.58 crore equity shares against an offer size of 6.25 crore equity shares, data showed.

371.title: CBI raids 105 locations in India against cyber criminals under 'Operation Chakra'
371.article_body: The CBI is carrying out searches at 105 locations in India under 'Operation Chakra' in action against cyber criminals. The operation is being carried out after inputs from the Federal Bureau of Investigation and Interpol, reports said. Raids reportedly took place in Delhi, Punjab, Karnataka, Assam and other states and ₹1.5 crore in cash and 1.5 kg gold were recovered.

372.title: PM Modi shares pics of AIIMS Bilaspur constructed at cost of ₹1,470 crore
372.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of AIIMS Bilaspur, which is constructed at a cost of ₹1,470 crore. PM Modi will inaugurate the facility in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. "I am glad that the AIIMS Bilaspur will be dedicated to the nation. It will ensure better healthcare facilities for people in the region," he wrote.

373.title: New Hindu temple with 16 deities to open from today in Dubai, pics surface
373.article_body: A new Hindu temple constructed in Jebel Ali in Dubai is set to open on Tuesday, one day ahead of Dussehra. The temple welcomes people of all faiths and has allowed entry to visitors to view the 16 deities and other interior works, reported Gulf News. According to the website, it will be open from 6:30 am to 8 pm.

374.title: India's 19-yr-old Mumtaz wins FIH women's 'Rising Star of the Year' award
374.article_body: India's Mumtaz Khan has been announced the International Hockey Federation's (FIH) 'Rising Star of the Year' for 2021-22 in the women's category. The 19-year-old forward was the best performer for India at FIH Junior Women's World Cup 2022, scoring eight goals in six matches. France's Timothée Clement has won the award in the men's category.

375.title: Deepak Chahar gives 'mankad' warning to South Africa batter, smiles at him; video goes viral
375.article_body: During the 16th over of South Africa's innings in the third T20I, Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar stopped mid-way during his run-up seeing non-striker Tristan Stubbs leaving his crease. Chahar then warned Stubbs about 'mankading' and smiled at him. Notably, 'mankading' has been shifted from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out' in MCC rules effective October 1.

376.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 announced, only 1 Indian included
376.article_body: The ICC has announced 20 match officials (16 umpires and four match referees) for the first round and Super 12 stages of ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. Nitin Menon is the only match official from India to have been included. Marais Erasmus, Rodney Tucker and Aleem Dar will appear in their seventh ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

377.title: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' crosses ₹250 cr worldwide in 4 days
377.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has crossed the ₹250-crore mark at the worldwide box office within four days of its release. The film was released in theatres across the globe in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada. 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' stars Vikram, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Trisha and Karthi, among others.

378.title: Was disheartened, 'Adipurush' meant for big screen: Director on trolling
378.article_body: Director Om Raut said that he was disheartened by people's reaction to the teaser of his upcoming film 'Adipurush'. "[I'm] not surprised because the film is made for...the big screen...Given a choice, I'd never put it on YouTube but that's the need of the hour," he added. Twitter users trolled the film's VFX after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released.

379.title: PM Modi shares video of boy giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit
379.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a video where a boy can be heard giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit. "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort," the PM tweeted. The now-viral video shows few children playing cricket on a street. PM Modi also shared another video of a person giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit in Kashi.

380.title: Bajrang Dal activists barge into garba event in Guj, beat up bouncers
380.article_body: Some people said to be from Bajrang Dal barged into a garba event in Gujarat's Surat on Monday and attacked bouncers there. Two of the bouncers were injured in the incident. "We have deployed police staff at same garba event and extra police [force] has been deployed to prevent any untoward incident," the Deputy Commissioner said.

381.title: Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' to be screened at Busan Film Festival
381.article_body: Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' will be screened at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. Turmeric Media, the co-producer of the film, took to Twitter to announce the screening. The film, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, also featured Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil. Busan International Film Festival will take place from October 5 to October 14.

382.title: Will take 4-5 yrs to resolve stubble burning: Punjab pollution control body
382.article_body: It will take four to five years to resolve the stubble burning issue in Punjab, a state Pollution Control Board official said. He added, "Crop diversification is not a long term solution because it does not mean that biomass will not be produced by other crops.'' Crop diversification is among several initiatives the Centre proposed to resolve stubble burning.

383.title: Jemimah, Deepti batted well to help us get back in the game vs UAE: Mandhana
383.article_body: Praising Jemimah Rodrigues(75*) and Deepti Sharma(64) following India's 104-run win against  United Arab Emirates at Women's Asia Cup, India stand-in skipper Smriti Mandhana said, "Jemimah and Deepti batted really well to help us get back in the game." Jemimah and Deepti added a 128-run fourth-wicket partnership after India were reduced to 20/3 inside the fifth over.

384.title: Viral photo from US shows windows that didn't shatter during Hurricane Ian
384.article_body: A photo showing windows that didn't shatter amid Hurricane Ian that hit US' Florida has gone viral. The photo is from Naples and it was shared by Dixie Whatley, who is a former TV journalist. It shows water reaching a great height outside her windows. However, the window panes didn't shatter and prevented the flood water from gushing in.

385.title: Empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications: EC
385.article_body: The Election Commission told political parties that empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications and that it can't overlook inadequate disclosures. The EC also asked political parties to provide authentic information to assess their financial viability and also to seek the views of the voters. The disclosure seeks to assess availability of the financial resources to implement the promises.

386.title: Kerala firm makes ₹5 crore profit by selling 7,382 tonnes of waste
386.article_body: Clean Kerala Company Limited (CKCL) has reported a profit of ₹5 crore by selling 7,382 tonnes of dry and recyclable waste. CKCL generated the profit within 20 months of launching operations in January 2021. It also collected and sold 1,972 tonnes of e-waste to recycling and processing units. CKCL is a joint venture of the state government and local bodies.

387.title: PM speaks with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, discusses ongoing conflict
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held a telephonic conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. PM Modi reiterated his call for early cessation of hostilities and the need to pursue the path of dialogue and diplomacy. He said India attaches importance to the safety and security of nuclear installations, including in Ukraine.

388.title: Politically motivated: Sisodia on probe ordered by Delhi L-G
388.article_body: Responding to Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena's statement that they will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia called the orders "politically motivated, illegal and unconstitutional". Sisodia, in a letter to Saxena, said that the Delhi government has the right to make decisions in all fields except land, police, public order and services.

389.title: SphitiCap launches maiden early-stage fund of $500 mn
389.article_body: Venture Capital firm SphitiCap has launched its maiden early-stage fund with a $500 million corpus which it will invest in companies focusing on sustainability, growth and impact. SphitiCap was founded in 2022 and will invest an average of $10 million in Indian startups from the seed stage to Series A. It was founded by Pallav Kumar Singh and Mayank Mehra.

390.title: Container truck hits 3-wheeler vehicle in Gujarat; 5 killed, 4 injured
390.article_body: Five persons were killed and four others were injured after a container truck hit a three-wheeler ferrying passengers near Golden Chowki in Vadodara, Gujarat. The truck lost balance after hitting a car and jumped on the wrong side of the road after breaking the divider and crashed into the three-wheeler, police said. The truck was coming from Surat.

391.title: Himachal CM reviews preparations ahead of PM Modi's visit on Oct 5
391.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday reviewed arrangements and preparations ahead of PM Narendra Modi's programme in Bilaspur on October 5. PM Modi will inaugurate the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Bilaspur and lay the foundation stone for projects worth over ₹3,650 crore. "PM will also participate in Kullu Dussehra," CM Jairam Thakur said.

392.title: Video shows woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' at Ramleela in UP; 10 booked
392.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' song at a Ramleela event in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. A case has been registered against 10 members of the Ramleela committee, police said on Tuesday. The members have also been warned against indulging in any such action again, the Additional Superintendent of Police said.

393.title: Sara Ali Khan to play a freedom fighter in 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
393.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram to announce that Sara Ali Khan will play the lead role in an upcoming film, titled 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'. He mentioned that Sara will play a freedom fighter in a fictional tale set against the backdrop of the Quit India Movement in 1942. The film will go on the floors this month.

394.title: Arjun Kapoor in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule': Reports
394.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor is reportedly in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule', the sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise'. According to reports, Arjun Kapoor may play the role of a police officer in the film. Actors Fahadh Faasil and Rashmika Mandanna will also return for the sequel, which will be directed by Sukumar.

395.title: Bengaluru hospital warns mothers their babies may get kidnapped: Report
395.article_body: New mothers in West Bengaluru's Vani Vilas government hospital are reportedly being told to "hold on to their babies at all times, otherwise, they might get kidnapped". Hospital staff especially nurses and security guards are warning the mothers. A medical officer reportedly said such 'announcements' are routine and take place in all hospitals.

396.title: Increase in tea prices to offset impact of wage rate hike: Report
396.article_body: An ICRA report said that an increase in tea prices following global supply issues will likely offset the impact of increased wage rates in West Bengal and Assam. ICRA said that overall financial performance will likely see a year-on-year improvement in FY23. The report said that orthodox tea prices are at all-time high due to production disruptions in Sri Lanka.

397.title: 3-year-old US water startup 'Liquid Death' valued at $700 million
397.article_body: Three-year-old US-based startup 'Liquid Death', which sells water in beer-style cans, is now valued at $700 million. It raised $70 million in its latest funding round led by Science Ventures, with participation from other investors including music group Swedish House Mafia and comedian Whitney Cummings. Its investors believe it's the fastest growing non-alcoholic beverage of all time.

398.title: UPI payments cross ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022
398.article_body: Payments made through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) crossed the ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022, as per National Payments Corporation of India's data. In September, 678 crore transactions, in volume terms, were carried out. As many as 657.9 crore transactions worth ₹10.72 lakh crore had taken place in August, up from 628.8 crore transactions worth ₹10.62 lakh crore in July.

399.title: Govt approves ₹26,000 crore to install 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days
399.article_body: According to a telecom ministry spokesperson, the government has approved ₹26,000 crore for installation of 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days. The spokesperson added that financial support for the project will be provided by Universal Services Obligation Fund. The project was announced by Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw at the recent 'Digital India Conference of State IT Ministers'.

400.title: TRS leader distributes liquor, live chicken ahead of launch of T'gana CM's new party
400.article_body: TRS leader Rajanala Srihari on Tuesday distributed liquor bottles and live chicken to public ahead of launch of new party by Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao. Srihari reportedly distributed about 200 bottles of alcohol and 200 chicken as part of the celebrations. A video showed a long queue waiting to receive liquor bottles and chicken from Srihari.

401.title: BSF seizes heroine from Pakistani truck in Amritsar
401.article_body: The BSF has seized 435 grams of heroin concealed in a Pakistani truck transporting dry fruits from Afghanistan at the Integrated Check-Post in Attari in Punjab's Amritsar district. The contraband was allegedly smuggled from Pakistan and was attached to an iron plate wrapped in black adhesive tape with a magnet to the back mud-guard, the BSF said.
